Web3 security provider Olympix identified the cause of the exploit as unvalidated call data within the “ConnectorDeleverageParaswap” contract, allowing the attacker to manipulate data during flash loan calls. After the exploit funds were mixed with a Tornado mixer. Block Data ReferenceAttackerhttps://etherscan.io/address/0x6998584be49162cb1a718a3bf954dccb24028ff9https://etherscan.io/address/0x2913d90d94c9833b11a3e77f136da03075c04a0fhttps://etherscan.io/address/0x34611f6bbb0a5f6f8eb48146f4474bff842ae893Example Attack tx:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x3192b5c7a0650c459226bdb1de69e07fe84dad93d335e99ac5182a4c832a608fTornado deposit example: https://etherscan.io/tx/0xd5c9256919d6dc870c1799aafc678de04c14cfb66edcb280d8d59f554c3170e2

Title: WazirX: India Ka Bitcoin Exchange Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryWazirXIndia Exchange Multisig got compromised and lost $230M worth of assets on $ETHDetails of the ExploitOn July 19, 2024, the WazirX Multisig was exploited, resulting in the theft of $230M. The attacker managed to drain the funds by first compromising the signers' Externally Owned Accounts (EOAs) and subsequently changing the implementation of the Multisig. The attack began with a specific transaction (Etherscan link), where the attacker executed a delegate call from the compromised multisig to a proprietary contract deployed eight days earlier. The delegate call data was 0x804e1f0a000000000000000000000000ef279c2ab14960aa319008cbea384b9f8ac35fc6, which modified the slot 0 of the multisig proxy to point to the new proprietary contract. Tools like evm.storage confirmed that before the attack, slot 0 contained the standard safe implementation, and afterward, it pointed to the attacker's contract. Further analysis showed that after the implementation modification, all transactions to the Safe Multisig redirected delegate calls to the new address, which simply transferred assets to the attacker.Block Data ReferenceAttackerhttps://etherscan.io/address/0xd967113224c354600b3151e27aaba53e3034f372Attack tx:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x48164d3adbab78c2cb9876f6e17f88e321097fcd14cadd57556866e4ef3e185d

Title: LI.FI Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryJul 16, 2024, DeFi Protocol LI.FI Hit by $8M ExploitDetails of the ExploitOn July 16th, 2024, Li.Fi, a cross-chain DeFi protocol, suffered a significant exploit due to an arbitrary call vulnerability, resulting in a loss of approximately $8 million. The vulnerability resided in the depositToGasZipERC20 function within the GasZipFacet.sol contract. This function allowed the _swapData parameter to be passed directly to LibSwap.swap, which included a low-level call that could execute arbitrary functions. Since the attacker had control over _swap.callTo and _swap.callData, they were able to craft malicious calldata with transferFrom() calls. With sufficient token spending approval, the attacker executed unauthorized transferFrom() calls to siphon funds from the protocol. Li.Fi has advised users to revoke approvals for specific addresses and has disabled the affected smart contract facet to contain the exploit. This incident is particularly notable as it echoes a similar $600,000 loss in 2022 due to the same bug in the protocol’s swapping feature.Block Data ReferenceAttackerhttps://etherscan.io/address/0x7742ed59e9ecf1712bc4c6bdd0c526e903a7f2c8Vulnerable contacthttps://etherscan.io/address/0xf28a352377663ca134bd27b582b1a9a4dad7e534#codeAttack tx:https://etherscan.io/tx/0xd82fe84e63b1aa52e1ce540582ee0895ba4a71ec5e7a632a3faa1aff3e763873https://etherscan.io/tx/0x65a92b189e4ae0b8a8a02cd59c5e9f6832586bd5167d41a24eb4f4d2ac692755

Title: Farcana Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryJun-19-2024 Farcana Token was exploited with a loss of about 440k USDDetails of the ExploitOn June 19th, 2024, a Farcana  Token was exploited by a private key leaking and draining one of the Farcana treasuries which was a basic EOA. Block Data ReferenceExploiter:https://polygonscan.com/address/0x968115c2d84a555911906d266cdd81814ca1a464Initial transfer tx:https://polygonscan.com/tx/0xddba98579036fbc4ba961af2f84d98909fdff4cea819c7abd25dfba6046edd9a

Title: Pendle user phishing
Description: Quick SummaryJun-19-2024 Pendle user lost $1.4 million being a victim of a phishing scam.Block Data ReferenceExploiter:https://etherscan.io/address/0x0000db5c8b030ae20308ac975898e09741e70000Victim:https://etherscan.io/token/0xa9355a5d306c67027c54de0e5a72df76befa5694?a=0x62df98d3189cff1f9f1498991e9555c4275802eeFunds withdrawal:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x54a5fb32f243f5aa6d27c93c9f264e135f42205b07e0aa40fdaa858922240b24

Title: Sportsbet.io Exploited
Description: Quick SummaryOn June 21, 2024, Sportsbet.io was breached, resulting in a loss of $3.5 million.Details of the ExploitThe online crypto sports betting platform Sportsbet.io was likely hacked, losing approximately $3.5 million in USDT and TRX tokens. Crypto investigator zachxbt linked this theft to the same attacker who recently stole at least $55 million from the BtcTurk exchange. Sportsbet.io has yet to confirm the incident.

Title: CoinStats Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryJun-22-2024 CoinStats portfolio tracker was hacked and after using a phishing link users have lost about 2M USD.Details of the ExploitCryptocurrency portfolio manager CoinStats was hacked on Friday, resulting in the theft of over $2 million from 1,590 wallets. The platform shut down its application to mitigate the attack. Wallets created within CoinStats were affected, while connected wallets and CEXes remained secure. Some impacted users received phishing messages that directed them to a malicious website. CoinStats CEO Narek Gevorgyan confirmed $800,000 was stolen from two wallets that imported their seed phrases to CoinStats Wallet. Evidence suggests the North Korean Lazarus Group was behind the attack. CoinStats resumed operations on Monday with limited functionalities. Users with affected wallets were advised to move their funds immediately. The platform emphasized that only read-only access is required for connected wallets, ensuring their funds are not at risk.Block Data ReferenceExample of tx:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x8d0360632bc385171e20c12aa3152933bb041402bb3e06ab29136985a4745e57

Title: Holograph contract exploited
Description: Quick SummaryIn June 2024, Holograph, an NFT protocol, suffered a $14.4 million hack. A former developer exploited a vulnerability in the smart contracts to mint 1 billion HLG tokens, leading to a significant drop in token value.Details of the ExploitIn June 2024, Holograph, an NFT protocol based on Omnichain, suffered a $14.4 million hack when a former developer exploited an infinite mint vulnerability in the protocol’s smart contracts to mint 1 billion HLG tokens. The attacker’s address was approved to call the mint function, allowing them to bypass access controls by deploying a malicious smart contract on Mantle. After minting the tokens, they bridged them to the Ethereum network and began dumping them, causing the HLG token value to drop by 80% within nine hours, despite exchanges freezing approximately 200 million of the minted tokens.

Title: Fake SCROLL Token RugPull
Description: Quick SummaryMay-28-2024 fake SCROLL Token was rugged with a loss of about 290k USDDetails of the ExploitOn May 28th, 2024, a fake SCROLL Token was rugged via the backdoor ability of infinite minting on sale tx. Minted an extremely large amount of tokens and swapped for 76 ETH on Uniswap V2 dex on the Ethereum network. After that Ether was mixed by a Tornado mixer. Block Data ReferenceScammer:https://etherscan.io/address/0x55db954f0121e09ec838a20c216eabf35ca32cddRugPull tx:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x661505c39efe1174da44e0548158db95e8e71ce867d5b7190b9eabc9f314fe91

Title: YYS Token Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryJun-08-2024 YYS Token was exploited with a loss of about 29k USD.Details of the ExploitOn June 8, 2024, YYS token 0xE814Cc was exploited using the vulnerability in the sell function. Pancake V3 pool was used for borrowing 4,750,000  USDT for the Flashloan attack. Then funds were bridged to the Arbitrum network and mixed via Railgun mixer. Block Data ReferenceAttacker:https://bscscan.com/address/0x101723def8695f5bb8d5d4aa70869c10b5ff6340Exploit tx:https://bscscan.com/tx/0x397a09af6494c0bfcd89e010f5dd65d90f3ee1cf1ff813ce5b0c1d42a1c8dec9

Title: DMM Bitcoin CEX Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryIn May 2024, DMM Bitcoin, a centralized cryptocurrency exchange, suffered a $305 million loss in the largest blockchain hack in over a year.Details of the ExploitIn May 2024, DMM Bitcoin, a centralized cryptocurrency exchange in Japan, experienced a significant hack resulting in an estimated $305 million loss, marking the largest blockchain theft since December 2022 and the third-largest in history. Initially, the incident was identified through a large transfer of 4502.9 BTC, but the theft was confirmed when the stolen Bitcoin was dispersed to multiple addresses. DMM Bitcoin acknowledged the hack and took steps to secure deposits and investigate the breach, though it did not disclose the cause. Potential causes include exposed private keys, compromised signing processes, or address poisoning, though the exact method remains undetermined.

Title: Velocore DEX Exploited
Description: Quick SummaryOn June 2 Velocore was exploited and loss worth $6.8 million.Details of the ExploitOn June 2, 2024, Velocore experienced a security breach that resulted in the loss of approximately $6.8 million in ETH. The breach was due to vulnerabilities within the Balancer-style CPMM pool contract, particularly faulty logic in the velocore__execute() function and issues with the fee rate calculation logic that allowed effectiveFee1e9 to exceed 100%. Additionally, there was a potential underflow issue during single-token withdrawals and a lack of caller verification in the velocore__execute() function. The attacker used funds from Tornado Cash, executed the exploit, bridged the funds through Across Bridge, and redeposited them back into Tornado Cash. While all volatile pools in Linea and zkSyncEra Velocore were affected, stable pools and the Telos Velocore pools were not impacted as the issue was mitigated beforehand. The Blade fork of Velocore, which uses a different pool structure, was also unaffected. The team acknowledged the critical assistance from Hexagate, Hypernative, and Ironblock in identifying and addressing the exploit. Further updates and a detailed post-mortem are forthcoming.Block Data ReferenceFinal Fund Destination Address: 0xe4062fcade7ac0ed47ad794028967a2314ee02b3Exploiter EOAs:0x8cdc37ed79c5ef116b9dc2a53cb86acaca3716bf0xd8c465ecd8c6f1a0c114890f1ef553f82e59d274Exploiter Contracts:0xed4e130f6f9e68918996f7e1e46a3306b3e12cec0xb7f6354b2cfd3018b3261fbc63248a56a24ae91a0xc030fba4b741b770f03e715c3a27d02c41fc9dae0xf7f76b30a301524fe76508546B1e3762eF2B9267Attack txs:https://lineascan.build/tx/0xed11d5b013bf3296b1507da38b7bcb97845dd037d33d3d1b0c5e763889cdbed1https://lineascan.build/tx/0x37434e674efc4e7cfeed7746095301ace5636028906fe548b786ead286e35eb0https://explorer.zksync.io/tx/0x4156d73cadc18419220f5bcf10deb4d97a3d3f7533d63ba90daeabc5fd11ba17

Title: Lykke CEX Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryOn June 4 Lykke CEX was exploited and lost $22 million worth of crypto assets.Details of the ExploitLykke, a centralized cryptocurrency exchange based in Switzerland, halted withdrawals following a security breach on June 4, which resulted in the loss of over $22 million in crypto assets. The incident was publicly acknowledged by the Lykke team in a social media post on June 10. They assured users that their funds were safe and would be recovered, although both Lykke UK and Lykke Corp AG were affected by the attack.

Title: MetaDragonDao Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryMetaDragonDao was exploited on May 29, 2024. The exploiter grabbed ~$180k worth of $BNB.Details of the ExploitThe recent hacking incident resulted in over 4000 NFTs being compromised. Community members incurred losses of approximately 2400 NFTs after accounting for the META fund and marketing allocations. Additionally, some investors and liquidity providers experienced losses. The NFT contract remains insecure, so refrain from minting NFTs. Block Data ReferenceAttacker:https://bscscan.com/address/0xc468d9a3a5557bff457586438c130e3afbec2ff9Tornado deposit:https://bscscan.com/address/0x0d5550d52428e7e3175bfc9550207e4ad3859b17

Title: WINR Token Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryMay-31-2024 a $WINR token on Arbitrum was attacked, and the attacker managed to grab ~$15k worth of $WINR tokensBlock Data ReferenceAttacker:https://arbiscan.io/address/0xfeef112831cc8f790abe71b4b196c220ee26ecf3Attacker contract:Exploit tx:https://arbiscan.io/tx/0xf57f041cb6d8a10e11edab50b84e49b59ff834c7d114d1e049cedd654c36194d

Title: Orion protocol exploit
Description: Quick SummaryOn May-28-2024, Orion protocol was exploited with a losses about of 994k USD. Details of the ExploitThe root cause was improper updating of user liabilities during the removeLiability operation. The attacker manipulated the liabilities array of a controlled account through a series of preparation transactions, doubling the value of the user's collateral assets. This manipulation allowed the attacker to bypass the health check when borrowing assets. Specifically, due to the manipulated liabilities for account 0xf7a8c2, the exploiter borrowed more assets than allowed. The technical failures included inadequate handling logic in the removeLiability function and the failure to update user liabilities when releasing assets.Block Data ReferenceAttacker:https://bscscan.com/address/0x51177db1ff3b450007958447946a2eee388288d2Exploit tx:https://bscscan.com/tx/0x660837a1640dd9cc0561ab7ff6c85325edebfa17d8b11a3bb94457ba6dcae18c

Title: Galaxy Fox Token Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryOn May 10th, Galaxy Fox (GFOX) Token contract was exploited with a hacker's profit of about 330k USD.Details of the ExploitOn May 10th, the address 0xFcE19F exploited the GFOX token via the unverified exploiter contract 0x86C68d exploited unverified token treasury 0x11A4a57 and was able to withdraw and sell 1,255,219,434 GFOX tokens for about 108.7 ETH. Block Data ReferenceAttacker:https://etherscan.io/address/0xfce19f8f823759b5867ef9a5055a376f20c5e454Attacker contract:https://etherscan.io/address/0x86c68d9e13d8d6a70b6423ceb2aedb19b59f2aa5Example of exploit tx:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x12fe79f1de8aed0ba947cec4dce5d33368d649903cb45a5d3e915cc459e751fc

Title: Fake PIToken Rug Pull
Description: Quick SummaryOn May-14-2024 , the Fake PI Token token was rug pulled, resulting in losses of approximately $490k USD.Details of the ExploitOn May 14th, 2024, 0x85A78 performed massive dumping via exactInputV2Swap function. In multiple transactions uni v2 pool with WMATIC was mostly drained. After that funds were dispersed and partially withdrawn to OKX hot wallets. Block Data ReferenceScammer:https://polygonscan.com/address/0x85a78cbe58860b0225d9739ce299708ca6e455fdExample of OKX fundings:https://polygonscan.com/tx/0x52e5dd3f2cc43c9ef7de046a1e5b8154e7b849c09d5d025cf9fa133488973bbbDump txs:https://polygonscan.com/tx/0x26f791f6215d68cf947fe9eeda999989f22eae8b928b78feedddfc5ca2fbac60https://polygonscan.com/tx/0x88db8da195c9a28fdf24f08fb98da5000e7a7814e8627ffa23fd23153e14d7b9https://polygonscan.com/tx/0xf4325fbf29bdf98e0914243b9527e77ef21093c42b6cff40da612d3a7238f146https://polygonscan.com/tx/0x4a8ddb3366c5b6663d8613a35975e4f756c2fc25473f4f1e8f0182093e3ab79ehttps://polygonscan.com/tx/0xb7b5a62d32dc1f6098ba01172e506ba968e9d2b15a85a9220b68e27421886f4c

Title: Rain Exchange Exploited
Description: Quick SummaryRain exchange experienced an exploit resulting in the loss of ~$14mDetails of the ExploitOn April 29, 2024, the crypto exchange Rain was likely exploited, resulting in the loss of $14.8 million. Suspicious outflows from Rain's BTC, ETH, SOL, and XRP wallets were quickly transferred to instant exchanges and swapped for BTC and ETH. The stolen funds currently consist of 137.9 BTC and 1881 ETH.

Title: ALEXLabBTC Access Control Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryALEXLabBTC Exploit Results in $4.3 Million Theft and Subsequent RecoveryDetails of the ExploitA recent exploit targeted XLink, where the deployer at 0xb3955302E58FFFdf2da247E999Cd9755f652b13b executed four upgrades on a proxy contract linked to ALEXLabBTC. Within an hour, two addresses withdrew a total of $4.3 million in digital assets, which were transferred to addresses funded by TornadoCash. This attack was enabled through compromised private keys obtained via phishing, allowing the exploiter to drain assets from the XLink bridge. The XLink team paused smart contracts and the bridge in response. The attacker took control of XLink endpoints on BSC and Ethereum, upgrading them to a malicious contract, leading to the withdrawal of ~$4.3 million on BSC, which was later recovered with the help of a whitehat. Another $5 million, mainly LunarCrush tokens, are secured on Ethereum. Approximately $500k remains locked but secured. aBTC assets were unaffected as they are held in a custodian account at Cobo. The XLink team is monitoring the exploiter's wallets and coordinating with security partners to resolve the situation and return to normal operations, assuring the community that all necessary steps are being taken to address the exploit and assist affected users.Block Data ReferenceExploit Transactions:https://bscscan.com/tx/0x94746d33792aeb27d2066b6d8f3c8a8c7410fe15c9500059f35e0b21c9bfb416https://bscscan.com/tx/0x47e123af93add709bc2516f6a5db057dfbb1d66a75b693cd7980cd3eb28c7357Destination Addresses:https://bscscan.com/address/0xa747af2a527e72ce303353b458a1c51ebcd53188https://bscscan.com/address/0x27055ae433e9dcb30f6ebcc1a374cf5cc03c484e

Title: Pump.Fun
Description: Quick SummaryPump.fun Exploited for ~$2M. 12,300 $SOL were stolen from its contracts, reportedly by project's former team member who had a private key to the service and executed a flash loan attack.Details of the ExploitPump.Fun, a memecoin launchpad, was exploited today through a flashloan attack, resulting in the theft of at least 12,300 SOL, worth roughly $2 million. The attacker leveraged a compromised private key to execute the exploit, where Pump.Fun’s service account cosigned the malicious transactions. Using flashloans from MarginFi, the hacker withdrew liquidity meant to be migrated to Raydium and repaid the flashloan, also donating leftover funds to Solana token holders. The Pump.Fun team managed to upgrade their contracts to prevent further damage and assured that all user wallets and existing tokens on Raydium are secure. Trading on Pump.Fun was temporarily paused but has since resumed, and affected users will receive full liquidity restitution within 24 hours. The platform accused a former employee of exploiting their privileged position to access the withdraw authority, compromising the protocol’s internal systems. The incident has been reported to law enforcement, and the investigation continues.

Title: Gala Games Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryGala Games experienced the exploit in a potential private key leakage, which led to 5,000,000,001 $GALA tokens being minted, estimated at ~$220M at the moment of the hack. The exploiter started to exchange the tokens in batches via 0x Protocol.Details of the ExploitGala Games experienced a security incident on May 20 where a hacker exploited an access control vulnerability in the GALA token contract, seizing control of an admin address to mint 5 billion GALA tokens worth $216 million. The hacker quickly sold 592 million tokens for $21.8 million in ETH on decentralized exchanges like Uniswap and 0xProject, causing the token's price to drop by 20%. Gala Games detected the exploit, activated their blocklist function, which had been implemented a year earlier, and froze the rogue wallet, mitigating further damage. The Ethereum contract for GALA was secure and under the protection of a multi-sig wallet. The company worked with the FBI, DOJ, and international authorities to identify the hacker, who later returned approximately $22 million in ETH to a Gala-controlled wallet. The remaining funds were secured, and Gala Games plans to use the returned ETH to buy back and burn GALA tokens to stabilize the supply. Despite the rapid response, the incident caused significant market disruption, contrasting with the broader market rally following Ethereum ETF approval news. The exploit highlighted critical access control failures and suspicious internal activities, with historical incidents suggesting potential internal sabotage.Block Data ReferenceAttacker:https://etherscan.io/address/0xe2ca471124b124831e231fb835778840ad100f97Mint tx:https://etherscan.io/tx/0xa6d90abe17d17743a9cecab84bcefb0fd0bbfa0c61bba60fd2f680b0a2f077feList of sell txs can be found here:https://etherscan.io/token/0xd1d2eb1b1e90b638588728b4130137d262c87cae?a=0xe2ca471124b124831e231fb835778840ad100f97

Title: FENGSHOU Token Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryOn April 24th, FENGSHOU (NGFS)  was exploited. $191k was gained as an attacker's profit. Details of the ExploitThe FENGSHOU (NGFS) token contract has an access control vulnerability in the delegateCallReserves function, which allowed a malicious actor to change the UniSwapV2 proxy address. This created an opportunity for the exploit, resulting in the actor earning approximately $191,000 in USDT tokens.Block Data ReferenceAttacker:https://bscscan.com/address/0xd03d360dfc1dac7935e114d564a088077e6754a0Attacker contract:https://bscscan.com/address/0xc73781107d086754314f7720ca14ab8c5ad035e4Exploit tx:https://bscscan.com/tx/0x8ff764dde572928c353716358e271638fa05af54be69f043df72ad9ad054de25

Title: Sonne Lending Prototol Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryOn May 14th, Sonne protocol was exploited via Compound V2 insufficient precision vulnerability. Details of the ExploitSonne Finance on Optimism has been exploited using a known donation attack on Compound v2 forks, resulting in a loss of approximately $20 million. Despite previous precautions of setting collateral factors to 0% and burning collateral before increasing c-factors, the recent proposal to add VELO markets led to vulnerability. The transactions were scheduled on a multisig wallet with a two-day timelock. After the timelock expired, the exploiter added a c-factor to the markets and executed multiple transactions, exploiting the protocol.Key steps of the attack included:Adding liquidity and performing buy-sell operations to generate rewards for LP holders.Borrowing 35,469,150 VELO from the AMM pool and transferring it to the soVELO contract without minting corresponding soVELO tokens, inflating totalCash.Using a rounding error to borrow 265 WETH with just 2 wei soVELO.Repeating the steps to drain the soUSDC and soWETH markets.Block Data ReferenceAttacker:https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x5d0d99e9886581ff8fcb01f35804317f5ed80bbbExploit example tx:https://optimistic.etherscan.io/tx/0x45c0ccfd3ca1b4a937feebcb0f5a166c409c9e403070808835d41da40732db96Attacker contract:https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0xa78aefd483ce3919c0ad55c8a2e5c97cbac1caf8

Title: OSN Token Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryOn May 6th, OSN Token contract was exploited with a hacker's profit of about 110k USD.Details of the ExploitOn May 6th, the address 0x835B4 exploited the OSN token via the unverified exploiter contract 0x4a5ac. During multiple transactions, the exploiter repeatedly added liquidity using flashloan from the Pancake V3 pool and then performed buy-sell operations, which generated rewards for LP holders via the OSNLpDividendTracker contract, followed by removing liquidity. This allowed the attacker to gain unfair rewards worth approximately $110,000 USD.Block Data ReferenceAttacker:https://bscscan.com/address/0x835b45d38cbdccf99e609436ff38e31ac05bc502Attacker contract:https://bscscan.com/address/0x4a5acac3b62ef37cf6aaf21baf133323a18dafc2Example of exploit tx:https://bscscan.com/tx/0x03db905062fe4afbae22a8abd5c1e76c709d03cda6d7a9baefc7dd7aa1ee6681

Title: Fake Lifeform Token
Description: Quick SummaryOn May 8th, the team behind fake Lifeform executed an exit scam, making a profit of approximately $250,000 USD.Details of the ExploitOn May 8th, the fake Lifeform token was rug-pulled. The deployer exploited a backdoor by calling the removeLimits() function on the token contract, allowing them to mint unlimited tokens while selling. A total of 1,603,040,060,640,000 tokens were swapped for 81.2 ETH and dispersed across different addresses. Block Data ReferenceScammer:https://etherscan.io/address/0xb57b3644f87987fe4ece6c3cac689379367638feremoveLimits() call:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x302727f3870295468945723849731d1b9c6800ebf41b8fc2da39ca01bcaa7e1fSell:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x9c69a0643adbb556c43f8cd0d40a5823e1085c2b89e1739fb68b536e76c18143

Title: Predy finance Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryOn the 14th of May Predy finance on Arbitrum L2 network was exploited with losses about 464k USD. Details of the ExploitOn May 14th, Predy Finance on Arbitrum was exploited due to a vulnerability in the Lending Pool, which did not properly handle small positions, leading to arithmetic issues.Some of the funds, amounting to $293,000, were bridged to ETH and parked at address 0xeDe4E. The remaining $217,000 is still at the attacker's address on Arbitrum, 0x76b02.Block Data ReferenceExploiters:https://arbiscan.io/address/0x76b02ab483482740248e2ab38b5a879a31c6d008https://arbiscan.io/address/0xe1783b01639818ec1069890eff251f26ea936653Exploiter contract:https://arbiscan.io/address/0x8affdd350eb754b4652d9ea5070579394280cad9Exploit tx example:https://arbiscan.io/tx/0xbe163f651d23f0c9e4d4a443c0cc163134a31a1c2761b60188adcfd33178f50f

Title: Bloom exploit on Blast
Description: Quick SummaryOn the 9th of May Bloom on Blast was exploited with a losses about 600k USD. Details of the ExploitOn May 9th, Bloom on Blast was exploited due to an issue with specific Blast L2 rebasing tokens that weren't handled correctly. This vulnerability allowed the exploiter to gain $600,000 by exploiting the vulnerable Trading Blast contract. After that funds were bridged to the Ethereum mainnet.Block Data ReferenceExploiter:https://blastscan.io/txs?a=0x60e329396f6dfb17f49c41dd347f7e1036e181d4&p=2Contract used for interactions:https://blastscan.io/address/0xb59b25b2f9239a69b0f4a69b28f424a3c578f0abVulnerable implementation:https://blastscan.io/address/0xcc020e81b12b664fef0f534507969e06b7600afe#codeFunds stored here:https://etherscan.io/address/0xd6962cac3cf59bf1b509c243481dcde0be729834#tokentxns

Title: Genius Token Exit Scam
Description: Quick SummaryThe Genius token team executed a partial exit scam on May 5th, 2024, making a profit of approximately $1.2 million USD.Details of the ExploitThe original GNUS Token deployer 0x1804dE was funded on the Fantom chain by another scam wallet 0x548c63 initiated a function deployTokenManager on the InterchainProxy contract which is one of the core Axelar Network contracts. This function deployed a new token manager with a fake token 0xC77522 registered as a bridged token. Simultaneously, another address, 0x548c63, deployed and minted 100,000,000 fake tokens, 0xC77522, on the Fantom network.Subsequently, 500,000 of the fake tokens were bridged via Axelar to the Ethereum network and sold on the Uniswap DEX for 407 ETH.The profits were then mixed and sent to various addresses.Block Data ReferenceGNUS Token Deployer:https://etherscan.io/address/0x1804deca63705e18edf04f242b325bcd54a8b463Fake token manager:https://ftmscan.com/address/0x8c10c2867384c87d5a555e4f96C7036336b575C6#codeFantom fake token:https://ftmscan.com/address/0xC77522dC90A4F6E30d73C6E8612A7d357D027d17Bridging to Ethereum mainnet:https://ftmscan.com/tx/0x9fe599bfb8bd381b1f2d07b685e00e501828f68a9f9596050aa8f63a25c12ec6Ethereum mainnet sell: https://etherscan.io/tx/0xe8a5780cc89d9115acf307da9e6fae68e8b3634a8b41c77d81e95edb9085a407Two scammer addresses are linked to the transaction: https://ftmscan.com/tx/0xae046accf5c10965640c339a05ed3785b27834c219e18b8be6763ae9d91c9ac9

Title: NovaMind Exit Scam
Description: Quick SummaryNovaMind Token on the Ethereum chain was rug-pulled by the team with a loss of about  23.5  ETH($70,057 USD) Details of the ExploitThe token deployer sold a significant amount of tokens and performed an exit scam via token dumping on the DEX (Uniswap).  Tokens were swapped to 23.52 ETH and then funds were bridged to the Base L2 chain. Block Data ReferenceScammer:https://etherscan.io/address/0x96c5ba6bb2bf4679ddbddaf23f61b71e4ac3c915Sell tx:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x39be1bd4cbe6fdcdb06533aef2c974357a31257e62355534a981aaebea173a0fBase chain receiver:https://basescan.org/address/0x81746420aCF2c9cE7385f01F4E741d4D836cE34d

Title: Pike Finance Second Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryOn April 30, 2024, Pike Beta protocol suffered an exploit resulting in the loss of 99,970.48 ARB, 64,126 OP, and 479.39 ETH, totaling over $1.6 million. The attack was related to a vulnerability initially reported on April 26 concerning USDC, prompting protocol upgrades that inadvertently introduced new variables and storage misalignment, allowing attackers to withdraw funds.Details of the ExploitPike is a liquidity market facilitating lending and borrowing using native assets directly on their respective blockchains, without wrapping or cross-chain transfers. The exploit exploited a vulnerability introduced during protocol upgrades aimed at addressing an earlier USDC vulnerability. The attacker leveraged an upgrade function to insert their address into the protocol's active variable, allowing them to bypass admin access and withdraw funds.Block Data ReferenceAttacker Address: 0x19066f7431df29A0910d287C8822936Bb7D89E23Attacker Contract: 0x1da4Bc596BFb1087f2F7999b0340Fcba03C47fbDVictim Contract: 0xFC7599cfFea9De127a9f9C748CCb451a34d2F063Optimism Transaction: https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x19066f7431df29a0910d287c8822936bb7d89e23Arbitrum Transaction: https://arbiscan.io/address/0x19066f7431df29A0910d287C8822936Bb7D89E23Ethereum Transaction: https://etherscan.io/tx/0xe2912b8bf34d561983f2ae95f34e33ecc7792a2905a3e317fcc98052bce66431

Title: Pike Finance Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryThe USDC pool on Pike Beta was exploited by a hacker on April 26, 2024, resulting in the theft of 299,127 USDC. The exploit was facilitated by forged CCTP messages, allowing the attacker to drain USDC across Ethereum, Arbitrum, and Optimism chains. Protocol functions have been temporarily halted in response to the exploit.Details of the ExploitThe exploit targeted the USDC pool specifically on Pike Beta, with the hacker utilizing forged CCTP messages to drain USDC from multiple chains, including Arbitrum, and Optimism. However, assets on the Base chain and other chains remain unaffected by the exploit. After the exploit stolen funds were bridged the Ethereum mainnet and deposited to the tornado cash.Block Data ReferenceExploiter:0xAdaF1626aEC26A7937aE7d1Fa0664e6E0904C1d0Exploiter tx example:https://optimistic.etherscan.io/tx/0x12770a7284c8c89f19489e125376dda48afa4d7662a1c5b32872c83adda890e2https://arbiscan.io/tx/0x979ad9b7f5331ea8034305a83b5cd50aea88adec395fff8298dd90eb1b87667fTornado deposits: https://etherscan.io/address/0xadaf1626aec26a7937ae7d1fa0664e6e0904c1d0

Title: XBridge Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryXBridge, a cross-chain platform connecting Ethereum Mainnet and BNB chain, experienced a significant smart contract vulnerability on April 24, 2024. This exploit resulted in a loss of assets totaling approximately $1.9 million. The vulnerability allowed the attacker to seamlessly take away assets from the protocol.Details of the ExploitThe exploit was rooted in a faulty smart contract implementation due to a lack of regulated access control. The attacker invoked a call to the vulnerable contract's withdrawTokens function, enabling them to extract assets from the protocol. Additionally, a flaw in the listToken function allowed anyone to set themselves as the token owner without verification, facilitating unauthorized access to assets.Block Data ReferenceExploiter:https://etherscan.io/address/0x0cfc28d16d07219249c6d6d6ae24e7132ee4caa7Exploiter tx example:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x903d88a92cbc0165a7f662305ac1bff97430dbcccaa0fe71e101e18aa9109c92Funds are held by exploiter on two networks:https://etherscan.io/address/0x0cfc28d16d07219249c6d6d6ae24e7132ee4caa7https://bscscan.com/address/0x0cfc28d16d07219249c6d6d6ae24e7132ee4caa7

Title: AirDAO Exploited
Description: Quick SummaryAirDAO faced a security breach, losing about 440K USD. The attacker exploited the wallet, leading to a loss of control over funds.Details of the ExploitA breach at AirDAO resulted in the unauthorized transfer of 126.5 $ETH and 41.61M $AMB tokens. The attacker seized control of the victim's wallet, leading to the loss of access and control over the funds. The first wallet removed liquidity from ETH/AMB pool and the second one just drained the AMB treasury. The attacker then engaged in transactions across multiple exchanges, including #Binance, #MEXC, #ChangeNOW, #KuCoin, and #BitMart. Stolen funds were converted to $ETH and subsequently deposited into @MEXC_Official via various addresses.Block Data ReferenceRemoving liquidity:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x2e0087b709f158c4272a02bf0038b2770a94d8146b2633d7d1bbb2c452ec91b4AMB draining:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x46d0f576605784ee8f10db49a46b8d61f3e5c543f48a1b0dc0e7151e6d25ff1ehttps://etherscan.io/tx/0xdab3475f4d8283efdbced3a90ca9c88f81cd598622792aadc4b526ca1cc343feExample of MEXC deposits:https://etherscan.io/tx/0xafde2ebe0fc873f547b8361621f0e2ab0a002b78594e1e13e52e30b1d9e8edda

Title: Remilia Treasury Exploited
Description: Quick SummaryCrypto Breach: Millions in Ether and NFTs Compromised, Milady Founder Responds.Details of the ExploitCharlotte Fang, founder of Milady and Remilia, confirmed a security breach resulting in millions of dollars' worth of Ether and NFTs being moved to a wallet involved in asset liquidation. Dumpster DAO first noticed the unusual transaction, prompting Fang's acknowledgment of a breach involving the Remilia treasury. The breach, attributed to unknown malware infiltrating Fang's password manager, affected connected wallets, including the multisig wallet for Remilia's funds. Assets were sold for around 850 ETH, nearly $3 million. Despite this, Fang assured that NFT ownership and the operating treasury were secure. The organization has no immediate plans to sell NFTs, minimizing impact on budgeted operations. The crypto community, skeptical of Fang's claims, prompted investigation by Web 3 security experts like Peckshield. This incident follows controversy in September, where Fang disclosed a misappropriation of $1 million from the treasury and faced accusations of misusing $1.7 million, leading to a lawsuit and removal due to alleged dissemination of extremist content. Milady, featuring anime-style women NFTs, has garnered attention despite these challenges.Block Data ReferenceExploiter:https://etherscan.io/address/0x778Be423ef77A20A4493f846BdbcDDfc30252cE9Treasury:https://etherscan.io/address/0xcf3e932f72e5f15411d125ad80579a3ef205b9b4

Title: DegenFox Token Rug Pull
Description: Quick SummaryOn April 4th, 2024, the DegenFox token was rug pulled, resulting in losses of approximately $150,000 USD.Details of the ExploitOn April 4th, 2024, suspicions arose regarding the DegenFox token deployer due to suspicious activity. Funds were withdrawn from both the BSC and BASE networks and bridged to the Ethereum mainnet. Subsequently, a portion of the withdrawn funds was deposited into Tornado Cash, while the majority remained held in the Ethereum mainnet account.Block Data ReferenceDeployer:https://bscscan.com/address/0xE0ABdc5846CbA938903D0b4eC51724B536276710https://basescan.org/address/0xE0ABdc5846CbA938903D0b4eC51724B536276710Tornado cash tx:https://etherscan.io/tx/0xa31ac3d518bd9ebd808294c1037fe71abe3875d45d64537b25ae5c1d5dd4f7e3

Title: Sumer Money Flashloan attack
Description: Quick SummaryThe Summer Money protocol was exploited via a flash loan attack, resulting in losses of approximately $350,000 USD.Details of the ExploitThe Summer Money protocol was exploited on the Base L2 blockchain, resulting in losses of approximately $350,000 USD. The attacker utilized an unverified contract for the attack, executing a flash loan of 150 ETH and 645,000 USDC to deposit into Summer ETH and USDC wrapper contracts. This created an opportunity to withdraw an additional 10 wrapped Coinbase Ethereum and 310,000 USDC tokens.Block Data ReferenceExploiter:https://basescan.org/address/0xbb344544ad328b5492397e967fe81737855e7e77Flashloan tx:https://basescan.org/tx/0x619c44af9fedb8f5feea2dcae1da94b6d7e5e0e7f4f4a99352b6c4f5e43a4661Exploiter contract:https://basescan.org/address/0x13d27a2d66ea33a4bc581d5fefb0b2a8defe9fe7

Title: Hedgey finance exploit
Description: Quick SummaryThe Hedgey Finance-related contract was drained of approximately 2 million USD.Details of the ExploitThe exploiter utilized the Balancer Vault flash loan exploit to target the victim contract, abusing the createLockedCampaign function. This enabled them to withdraw a substantial amount of USDC (1,303,910) and NOBL (680,000) tokens. Furthermore, it appears that the vulnerability in the victim contract was exploited by other malicious actors unrelated to the main exploiter. After that, all tokens were swapped to DAI and sent to another EOA. Block Data ReferenceExploiter:https://etherscan.io/address/0xded2b1a426e1b7d415a40bcad44e98f47181dda2Flashloan tx:https://etherscan.io/tx/0xa17fdb804728f226fcd10e78eae5247abd984e0f03301312315b89cae25aa517Exploiter contract:https://etherscan.io/address/0xc793113f1548b97e37c409f39244ee44241bf2b3USDC drain:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x2606d459a50ca4920722a111745c2eeced1d8a01ff25ee762e22d5d4b1595739NOBL drain:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x7cd6fc130a86e22809e081e4ec9198404bb7e9b9d694c90524654d3569207bd3Finally, funds held by: https://etherscan.io/address/0xd84f48b7d1aafa7bd5905c95c5d1ffb2625ada46

Title: Empower AI Rug Pull
Description: Quick SummaryEmpower AI on the Ethereum chain was rug-pulled by the team with a loss of about  240K USD.Details of the ExploitThe Empower AI token was exit scammed via an insider job. The malicious unverified contract allowed the scammer to sell a significant amount of tokens without having it on his balance. EOA which performed an exit scam via token dumping on the DEX (Uniswap) earned 66 ETH or approx 230K USD.Block Data ReferenceScammer:https://bscscan.com/address/0x484fd20d8f1b4c5c6049cde316a4d9d9216c1f6bUnverified contract: https://etherscan.io/address/0xe4808c6b9fb741cafa13b195cdba45c27dfbf3baSell tx:https://etherscan.io/tx/0xfdbcd2c9abbb4db7b8959039b071f71b9ab90374170e1b5321f760a4becd033a

Title: SAGA Fake token rug pull
Description: Quick SummaryFake SAGA Token on the BNB chain was rug-pulled by the team with a loss of about  1.6M USDTDetails of the ExploitThe fake token deployer sent a significant amount of tokens to another EOA which performed an exit scam via token dumping on the DEX (Pancake).  The biggest sale drain pool for about of 1,592,169 USDT tokens. Block Data ReferenceScammer:https://bscscan.com/address/0x484fd20d8f1b4c5c6049cde316a4d9d9216c1f6bSell tx:https://bscscan.com/tx/0x5096b42e51ecd4ccb7f713d5ace7f45a6cddc14c261a29035b46c40da6ffc48c

Title: Chainge Finance protocol exploit
Description: Quick SummaryThe address possibly associated with Chainge Finance on BSC was drained. The exploited contract is temporarily paused, and users are warned not to approve or revoke approvals from it. The hack amount totals approximately $710kDetails of the Exploit0x80a0d7a6fd2a22982ce282933b384568e5c852bf, suspected to be connected to Chainge Finance on the Binance Smart Chain was exploited. As a precautionary measure, the project team has temporarily halted the contract's functionality. Users are strongly advised not to approve transactions related to this contract and to revoke any existing approvals if necessary. The breach has resulted in losses amounting to approximately $710k. Notably, the sole victim identified so far is the address 0x8a4aa176007196d48d39c89402d3753c39ae64c1, which is associated with the project team.Block Data ReferenceExploited contract:https://bscscan.com/address/0x80a0d7a6fd2a22982ce282933b384568e5c852bfExploit tx:https://bscscan.com/tx/0x051276afa96f2a2bd2ac224339793d82f6076f76ffa8d1b9e6febd49a4ec11b2Exploiter:https://bscscan.com/address/0x6eec0f4c017afe3dfadf32b51339c37e9fd59dfbExploiter contract:https://bscscan.com/address/0x791c6542bc52efe4f20df0ee672b88579ae3fd9a

Title: Grand Base access control issue
Description: Quick SummaryGrand Base faced a severe issue, resulting in the unauthorized minting of $GB tokens on the base chain and a subsequent massive decline in token value. Approximately $2M worth of assets, including 615 $ETH, were transferred to #ETH wallets.Details of the ExploitThe security breach at Grand Base involved the compromise of their deployer's wallet, allowing the attacker to mint $GB tokens on #BASEChain without authorization. This incident triggered a significant devaluation of the token, with prices plummeting by more than 99%. Furthermore, the attacker managed to transfer around 615 $ETH, equivalent to $2M, to #ETH wallets. The breach has prompted questions about the security measures in place and the possibility of a private key leak.Block Data ReferenceDeployer:https://basescan.org/address/0xa288b6b80c02f3a7916609fde831b30e9fa6ba07Minting:https://basescan.org/tx/0xe8b0af9a2c7a3482958792d620328aa780097788fc18e1b7e1328a4a459132d0https://basescan.org/tx/0x74237dfd7ac0e251311c71ff2c2536b146eeb68c465d47325bdd4517f34a7259Swaps:https://basescan.org/token/0x2af864fb54b55900cd58d19c7102d9e4fa8d84a3?a=0xcfe5f1bae0da05ffe9c9c73411b8ec1a286350fc

Title: Lucky Star Access Control Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryThe Access control issue over the Lucky Star contract led to the approved tokens draining.Details of the ExploitA security breach occurred with Lucky Star contracts, where the deployer transferred ownership of the proxy admin to a malicious EOA. This EOA then upgraded to a new implementation with the unverified source code, exploiting users who had previously approved the proxy admin. As a result, approximately $297k worth of LSC and USDT tokens were stolen.Block Data ReferenceDeployer:https://bscscan.com/address/0xcde285a531b35d40f4e92a1a6677b991fee4cd01Transfer ownership:https://bscscan.com/tx/0xbb2e8abb11ac2bc5a862f7660c52cca5d6815ed24d11fbe2fb7bc676967e8d61Malicious upgrade: https://bscscan.com/tx/0xb5e79163d1d84835bf3b771274bcde19be306f0882e57b939a129e84f38df523Proxy admin:https://bscscan.com/address/0x6b2ee1995da5eaf6caa8aed3f849265a4c2b80caProxy contract:https://bscscan.com/address/0x077e1E0c96cBbFB604c8bF191C2849A196E7c9eb#codeMalicious implementation: https://bscscan.com/address/0x32e484A199D29Ee1A8f47d9f9DD11Fe9B74222A9#code

Title: FA Token Rug Pull
Description: Quick SummarySignificant dumping occurred with the FA token, where the deployer withdrew 515k FA tokens, later selling them for approximately 255k USDT.Details of the ExploitOn the Binance Smart Chain (BSC), a notable rug pull event unfolded with FA token. The deployer of the token contract executed a transaction resulting in the withdrawal of approximately 515k FA tokens from the protocol's treasury. Subsequently, these tokens were swiftly sold on the market.  Upon analysis, it was determined that the deployer's actions led to a significant profit of $341k, factoring in the initial liquidity provided.Block Data ReferenceExploiter:https://bscscan.com/address/0xb6a0bc695c7499b5966d9b6ebee55efe4f87e515Withdraw tx:https://bscscan.com/tx/0xd5d4d818782b68c24e83eccb00f2d6d67ebf3a0fb0403d96c6e54e0ed5f74a2aSell TX:https://bscscan.com/tx/0xa6249bfbca134955379424eb873d67cf8fc67363fdeea3c90ab58517cb245a2a

Title: Solareum Solana trading bot scammed
Description: Quick SummarySolareum, a Telegram trading app for Solana tokens, is shutting down after a $523,000 security breach.Details of the ExploitThe exploit affected over 300 Solana users, with suspicions initially falling on the BONKbot trading bot. However, the BONK team refuted this and provided data indicating that victims had interacted with Solareum. Despite efforts to secure additional funding and enhance security measures, Solareum's closure was prompted by the recent breach and financial constraints. Users on Solareum's Telegram channel are demanding answers and potential compensation, while Decrypt's attempts to reach Solareum for comment remain unanswered.

Title: URF Token Rug Pull
Description: Quick SummaryURF, a meme coin presale on Solana, raising around 2400 SOL ($450k). However, the project vanished after launch, with inactive social media since March 26.Details of the Exploit@BryceHall's endorsement led to a significant investment in URF's presale, accumulating 2400 SOL ($450k). Yet, the project's team disappeared post-launch, leaving investors without updates. Social media channels have been inactive since March 26.Block Data ReferenceURF presale scammer: 2Y8hZh5on4q9wyqXoNYC8oYPUVQMunrzqW8qDmxup4R8

Title: Condom token Rug Pull
Description: Quick SummaryCondom presale raised over $900k and performed exit scam. Details of the ExploitOn the 4th of April presale performed by the Condom token team was rigged with a profit of 4,965 $SOL. Social media were deleted as well. Block Data ReferenceScammer:4gHb9tUASDRgpe2vdi6Y2jh8mbSqPCmyf1ZvSUcazKSc

Title: ALI token holder fishing
Description: Quick SummaryOn the 1st of March 2024, $4.3M was fished from an ALI token holder.Details of the ExploitThe hack targeted wallet 0x7653C9364bB800E1136aa0634c4629eBe76A744E, where 113,102,183 ALI Utility Tokens were stolen using the Inferno Drainer service. In response, a rapid community governance vote was conducted, leading to the burning of the stolen tokens.Block Data ReferenceExploiter:https://etherscan.io/address/0x2ee9a1751b6c8034961cb192bf3a8b9110621edbVictim:https://etherscan.io/address/0x7653C9364bB800E1136aa0634c4629eBe76A744EDrain TX:https://etherscan.io/tx/0xc943ea893065cc7deac1a42d1670da1a9ebeb9fc1807bf3d835224dd499417cc

Title: LavaLending Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryLavaLending experienced a flash loan exploit resulting in the theft of approximately $340K worth of various cryptocurrencies.Details of the ExploitLavaLending fell victim to a flash loan exploit, resulting in the unauthorized transfer of funds totaling approximately $340K. The stolen cryptocurrencies include 60,349 USDT, 8.5 wstETH, 96,215 UDSC.e, 77,477 USDC, and 20.3 ETH. These funds were sent to the address 0xfbcdb6ceca13b0e2ca51e86c94d78faab10a6428 on the Arbitrum network. In response to the incident, all lending markets on the platform have been temporarily paused while an investigation is conducted to determine the extent of the breach and identify the perpetrators.Block Data ReferenceExploiter:https://arbiscan.io/address/0x851aa754c39bf23cdaac2025367514dfd7530418https://arbiscan.io/address/0xfbcdb6ceca13b0e2ca51e86c94d78faab10a6428Expliter contract:https://arbiscan.io/address/0x42fae47296b26385c4a5b62c46e4305a27c88988https://arbiscan.io/address/0x3e52c217a902002ca296fe6769c22fedaee9fda1

Title: OpenLeverage exploited
Description: Quick SummaryApr-01-2024 OpenLeverage on the BNB chain was exploited for about $236KDetails of the ExploitApr-01-2024 OpenLeverage was attacked with a loss of about 236k USD. The attacker was funded by mixer Tornado Cash and currently holds profit in BNB in his wallet. Block Data ReferenceExploiter:https://bscscan.com/address/0x5bb5b6d41c3e5e41d9b9ed33d12f1537a1293d5fTornado funding:https://bscscan.com/tx/0x28a97a12d18d78bd245c4ba5630da4d8c6103fee13ad4b1e40c54909654871e6Exploit tx: https://bscscan.com/tx/0xf08b6d36dc6f650c030344b6307ae94528f77a01db11d1284ed966e7e44337d3Expliter contract:https://bscscan.com/address/0xd0c8af170397c04525a02234b65e9a39969f4e93
