Title: Dolomite Approval Attack
Description: Quick SummaryDolomite encountered an approval attack, leading to approximately $1.9 million in losses on the Ethereum network.Details of the ExploitThe attacker exploited the batchTransfer feature within the TradeDelegate contract, exploiting users' approved tokens and transferring them to the malicious contract. This method allowed the hacker to execute unauthorized transfers of approved tokens, resulting in significant financial losses.

Title: Wilder token draining
Description: Quick SummaryA contract affiliated with "zero name service" incurred losses exceeding $1.4 million in Wilder tokens due to a malevolent contract upgrade.Details of the ExploitThe exploit entailed a malicious upgrade of the contract, leading to substantial losses amounting to over $1.4 million in Wilder tokens. Notably, the perpetrator's address 0x6584a486f711eb8ac47abf78a5c8e218ee758fa9 has been identified in connection with the attack. Funds from the victim's address are currently being directed towards Tornado Cash, indicating potential laundering efforts.Block Data ReferenceAttacker:https://etherscan.io/address/0x6584a486f711eb8ac47abf78a5c8e218ee758fa9Exploited proxy admin:https://etherscan.io/address/0x6ca959fbc8e3df1fbea5d9791de0047e1b3a57c6Example of drain TX:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x291ae90f56e3dc3559dfa670871b2b1e222acdea83fe21272ccf9430c7ae5574

Title: Mozaic Finance Access Control Issue
Description: Quick SummaryMar-15-2024 Mozaic Finance was hacked on Arbitrum, leading to a loss of approximately $2.1 million.Details of the ExploitMozaic_Fi's breach stemmed from compromised access controls within the Arbitrum network. Vaults were drained for about $2.1M in USDT tokens. Subsequently, the stolen funds were funneled to @MEXC_Official.Block Data ReferenceAttacker:https://arbiscan.io/address/0xd6d4e8038df50803412d1b1ad2c9845bacf7c52bExploit tx:https://arbiscan.io/tx/0xed6c13860eda65d7b5390f38cfd9f5fb602f25ef76ac781abb2e81d1e90f588bhttps://arbiscan.io/tx/0x96045356681341b4c9cf991d786f99eb845d98afc8229dcd82b604e2c8989a02https://arbiscan.io/tx/0x98097feec85e77dcca6ce94e612b6b1a114d5466a1affa29cc9963fecdbed7c5https://arbiscan.io/tx/0xf509a32a518b88436cf01b5f672faeff5175f4c830b5d5aca89003799ac8a8cbhttps://arbiscan.io/tx/0x52b78eec8556c24513f92e8344c069fca6a48ec2ae829e5508333ad416d726f4

Title: Munchables Draining Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryMunchables protocol has been compromised and drained for 17.4K ETH ($62.5M)Details of the ExploitBefore the attack munchables contract 0x29958E used Upgradeable proxy patterns with unverified source code, thus we can't be sure if this was a rug pull event or access control vulnerability. The exploiter called function 0x7eee288d directly on the victim contract and withdrew ether. After a short period, all funds were returned to the protocol-related multi-signature wallet. Block Data ReferenceAttacker:https://blastscan.io/address/0x6e8836f050a315611208a5cd7e228701563d09c5Exploit tx:https://blastscan.io/tx/0x9a7e4d16ed15b0367b8ad677eaf1db6a2a54663610696d69e1b4aa1a08f55c95Unverified proxy implementation:https://blastscan.io/address/0xf563Ce437E3aB8e0B79585dF5122700FBc42aFcdProxy admin:https://blastscan.io/address/0x87684Be62a2769BBee7b9945bA91D67B53dAD153

Title: Flashloan attack on ZongZi token
Description: Quick SummaryZongZiFa token has been exploited with losses of about ~230K USD.Details of the ExploitZongZiFa token has been attacked with a hacker's profit of 383BNB or $227,607. 1,904 BNBs were taken as a flashloan from the Pancake USDT/WBNB pool and used for a mathematic attack over ZongZi contract logic which led to losses of about 230k USD,Block Data ReferenceAttacker:0x2c42824eF89d6EFa7847d3997266b62599560a26Pair address:https://bscscan.com/address/0xd695c08a4c3b9fc646457ad6b0dc0a3b8f1219feExploit tx:https://bscscan.com/tx/0x247f4b3dbde9d8ab95c9766588d80f8dae835129225775ebd05a6dd2c69cd79f

Title: Fake ether.fi  Rug Pull
Description: Quick SummaryA fake token named Ether.fi ($ETHFI) has experienced a drastic drop of -100%. The deployer, identified as 0xa3b27...980D, executed a swap of 1,769,800,761,000,000 fake $ETHFI tokens, equivalent to approximately ~$354.1K, for about 88.56 Wrapped Ether (WETH).Details of the ExploitThe fraudulent token, Ether.fi ($ETHFI), witnessed a sudden and significant decline of -100%. The deployer of this fake token, with the address 0xa3b27...980D, conducted a swap transaction involving 1,769,800,761,000,000 units of the fake $ETHFI tokens. This swap resulted in the acquisition of approximately 88.56 Wrapped Ether (WETH), with an estimated value of around $354.1K.Block Data ReferenceDeployer:https://etherscan.io/address/0xa3b27edcde280dd0bc7ef43697bfb5828730980dRug Tx:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x91889008bf982abe3efd2223dca11890cf077e15a713f6e5844c08145c1801a0

Title: HGM and AGSC tokens exploit
Description: Quick SummarySuspicious transactions involving Ant God Share Coin and Home Gould Mine (HGM) on the Binance Smart Chain (BSC) have been detected, resulting in a total loss of $75,000.Details of the ExploitMultiple transactions involving Ant God Share Coin and Home Gould Mine (HGM) on the Binance Smart Chain (BSC) were revealed as suspicious. These transactions resulted in a collective loss of $75,000. The attacker was funded by Tornado Cash. Following the attack, the stolen funds were deposited into an address associated with Tornado Cashas well.Block Data ReferenceExploiter:https://bscscan.com/address/0x27aeaa87e2a6db172a3b4ca623ad81af84dc9204#internaltxAttack tx:https://bscscan.com/tx/0x91a35e2b0631b2348a63b045b6162db434d5feae5f0d4e120deb5407b7e36134https://bscscan.com/tx/0xa49d5c9be70a5a7b8540ef596c05fbd10d2759a7481d9e7c5ba214db0d5f1da2Example of Tornado Cash deposit

Title: Eth Contingency Exit Scam
Description: Quick SummaryEthContingency ICO scam resurfaces with dormant funds worth $13.5 million.Details of the Exploit EthContingency conducted an ICO in early 2017, raising a substantial amount of 21,144 ETH when the price of ETH was approximately $17. However, shortly after the ICO, the project team disappeared, leaving investors empty-handed. Despite the team's disappearance, they retained control over the majority of the raised funds.Surprisingly, between 2021 and 2022, the dormant EthContingency team resurfaced, transferring over $25 million worth of ETH to the privacy-focused mixer, Tornado Cash. The sudden movement of funds raised eyebrows within the crypto community, shedding light on the abandoned ICO project's reemergence after years of silence.Currently, the EthContingency team still holds over 4600 ETH, equivalent to $13.5 million, across multiple wallet addresses. These funds remain untouched and dormant, raising questions about the team's intentions and the possibility of further actions with the remaining assets.Block Data ReferenceICO Address: 0xc96eec418b50c538c3f3e32e71575da068a97401Wallet Addresses with Dormant Funds:0x89e28ec97e3452309d20c6e3ab5312327bf44ed3: 2365 ETH0xbb4ed2b027c4339e85e759aa620e6c6139b56c0e: 1619 ETH0x5472d79792e6f13a539fa0a1c93a2d5d84618840: 404 ETH0x139bcb549b2c4d1ea2a035fd5ae2a967c61be961: 79 ETH0x4c756e1c8b65c7d8c67b296d815163750302b859: 64 ETH

Title: TGBS Token FlashLoan
Description: Quick SummaryFlash loan exploit on TGBS contract resulted in a loss of approximately $151k.Details of the ExploitThe exploit targeted the TGBS contract (bsc 0xedecfA18CAE067b2489A2287784a543069f950F4) through a flash loan scheme. The attacker took 1,229  BNB flashloan and executed multiple transactions, transferring a small amount of TGBS tokens to themselves. This action triggered a burning mechanism within the LP, resulting in the loss of approximately $151k. After that funds were transferred through Tornado cash.Block Data ReferenceExploiter:https://bscscan.com/address/0xFF1db040e4f2a44305E28f8dE728DABFF58f01E1Attack TX:https://bscscan.com/tx/0xa0408770d158af99a10c60474d6433f4c20f3052e54423f4e590321341d4f2a4Example of the Tornado deposit:https://bscscan.com/tx/0xc979d0474343e1fd02d7b8f5746fff8fe094ce64fa6f2c756675e0be0ea33852

Title: JUICE exploit
Description: Quick SummaryThe $JUICE Staking contract was exploited on March 9th, 2024, resulting in the loss of 1,303,811 $JUICE Tokens, which were immediately sold for approximately 54 ETH on Uniswap. The exploit was promptly addressed, and investigations were launched to understand the attack.Details of the ExploitThe $JUICE Staking contract was exploited on March 9th, 2024, allowing the attacker to drain 1,303,811 $JUICE Tokens and sell them for approximately 54 ETH on Uniswap. The exploit stemmed from vulnerabilities in the staking contract, which enabled the attacker to drain both the liquidity pool and users' staked tokens. Upon discovery, immediate actions were taken to disable the staking site, secure the infrastructure, and initiate investigations.Block Data ReferenceContract Drain Transactions:Transaction 1: https://etherscan.io/tx/0xc9b2cbc1437bbcd8c328b6d7cdbdae33d7d2a9ef07eca18b4922aac0430991e7Transaction 2: https://etherscan.io/tx/0x5812894b63989904a6d139f6fd5d52162eb9989451598630d2d2e14cbb731233Transaction 3: https://etherscan.io/tx/0xf9312da2459cdf2b22e66227f895c856a5184d0c69230cc592e4ce09705f363d

Title: Humanized_AI Exit Scam
Description: Quick SummaryHumanized_AI Exit Scam: $665K Raised, Operations CeasedDetails of the ExploitHumanized_AI, a blockchain project, orchestrated an exit scam after collecting approximately 173 ETH, equivalent to $665K, over a one-month period. The project conducted its token sale on various decentralized finance platforms, with the proceeds transferred to the address https://etherscan.io/address/0xef46843a7e115c8a9a85ecfc3328efdfad1bcc99. Additionally, the $665K funds were deposited into the eXch exchange. Following the scam, both the project's Twitter account and website have been deactivated, indicating a fraudulent exit from the project.Block Data ReferenceSale Contract https://etherscan.io/address/0x98afe3566b6e5f70f95a5e8c8e1f37b3aa93a15cExample of eXch deposithttps://etherscan.io/tx/0x4cc22495bc0574b8cc61a1332671ed1c381efc056c4d0f9fc7e9556e953296e7

Title: Aragon Network DAO Phishing
Description: Quick SummaryAragonDao fell victim to a fake token airdrop scam, resulting in a significant loss of funds 800k in USDC. Details of the ExploitThe exploit began with the attacker sending 7 USDC to AragonDao from a specific address (0x0cee33...CC3F0EBf). Subsequently, AragonDao was deceived into sending 800K USDC to the same spoofed address, resulting in a significant loss. The team responded by offering a 10% reward on the stolen assets, aiming to mitigate the impact of the attack.Block Data ReferenceThe initial attack transaction https://etherscan.io/tx/0xf32b4fa4aae39fa6db1fbea575fc699320e980342e2b1a34c5a5ae52a56524eAdditionally, the transaction offering a 10% reward on the stolen assets is available at https://etherscan.io/tx/0xb5fae765adc4440967b27c05bd94d74fdd1029e767a961d07df74307e2c8d1The attacker's deposit of $1.2M into TornadoCash can be found at https://etherscan.io/address/0x63d919e6f9ec2f0793b9119f4f9f26e30c2e6574.

Title: OrdiZK exit scam
Description: Quick SummaryOrdiZK conducted an exit scam, resulting in the deletion of its website and social media accounts. The project's deployer and team wallets hold around $1.4 million worth of ETH obtained through fraudulent activities.Details of the ExploitThe exit scam involving OrdiZK unfolded with the sudden disappearance of its website and social media presence. Investigations revealed that the project's deployer, along with other team wallets, orchestrated the scam, leading to significant financial losses. The deployer alone holds over $1 million worth of ETH, while the OrdiZK treasury and marketing wallets contain substantial amounts as well. The scam involved dumping tokens, removing ETH from project contracts, and diverting funds allocated for sales taxes. As a result, investors and participants in the OrdiZK project were left without recourse, facing substantial losses due to the fraudulent activities of the project team.Block Data ReferenceDeployer/Scammerhttps://etherscan.io/address/0xbfdd36f5ca739344a44758aa44c2cc439f679c83Example of sell TX:https://etherscan.io/tx/0xf1e612c2382f6efc15bff583b26132bb43c9f8e1ebbc3ab614821158091d7b33

Title: Unizen exploited
Description: Quick SummaryDeFi protocol Unizen suffered a $2.1 million exploit, prompting the immediate reimbursement of affected users. The exploit involved a compromised platform and the draining of user funds, leading to significant financial losses.Details of the ExploitOn March 9th, blockchain analytics firm PeckShield identified an "approve issue" with Unizen, resulting in over $2 million being drained from the platform. The attacker exchanged Tether (USDT) for Dai (DAI), causing substantial losses. Unizen quickly initiated bounty negotiations with the hacker and began collaborating with law enforcement and forensic experts to identify the perpetrator. Despite ongoing negotiations, Unizen promptly refunded 99% of affected users, with refunds starting on March 11th. CEO Sean Noga loaned funds to facilitate the reimbursement process, with users who lost below $750,000 receiving refunds in USDT or USD Coin (USDC).Block Data ReferenceVulnerable contract created:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x858c71876a5ad43ffe27f227ad01979f3bd5de95e66194e98cea41f53a43ef59

Title: WOOFi flashloan attack
Description: Quick SummaryWOOFi Swap on Arbitrum experienced an exploit resulting in a loss of approximately $8.5 million. The exploit involved flash loans and price manipulation, prompting the team to pause the contract.Details of the ExploitOn March 5th, at 15:49 UTC, the sPMM algorithm controlling pricing on WOOFi Swaps was exploited on Arbitrum. The attacker utilized flash loans to manipulate prices by performing frequent token swaps. Specifically, the hacker exploited a flaw in the price calculation within the WooPPV2 contract, enabling them to manipulate prices during swaps. Despite the swift containment of the threat within 13 minutes, the exploit led to significant financial losses.

Title: $ALI, $PUSH Phishing Exploit of the 0x7653c address
Description: Quick SummaryMassive Loss: $4.39M of $ALI and $PUSH Tokens Lost to Crypto PhishingDetails of the ExploitA staggering $4.39 million worth of $ALI and $PUSH tokens were recently lost to a crypto phishing scam. The victim, identified by the address 0x7653c9364bb800e1136aa0634c4629ebe76a744e, fell prey to the scam orchestrated by scammers with addresses 0x84672cc56b6dad30cfa5f9751d9ccae6c39e29cd and 0x2ee9a1751b6c8034961cb192bf3a8b9110621edb. The victim inadvertently signed a malicious Uniswap Permit2's Permit Batch message, facilitating the unauthorized transfer of tokens. Notably, the token spender involved is a Safe wallet address.Block Data ReferenceVictim's Address: 0x7653c9364bb800e1136aa0634c4629ebe76a744eScammer 1 Address: 0x84672cc56b6dad30cfa5f9751d9ccae6c39e29cdScammer 2 Address: 0x2ee9a1751b6c8034961cb192bf3a8b9110621edbExploit tx:https://etherscan.io/tx/0xc943ea893065cc7deac1a42d1670da1a9ebeb9fc1807bf3d835224dd499417cc

Title: Shido Access Control Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryAccess control issue leads to $4M Loss at ShidoGlobalDetails of the ExploitShidoGlobal recently encountered a transfer of ownership, resulting in a significant loss amounting to approximately $4 million. The exploit occurred when the new owner swiftly upgraded the StakingV4Proxy contract by introducing a concealed withdrawToken() function. This function enabled the attacker to execute withdrawals of the entire balance of 4,353,473,223.864904 $SHIDO tokens from the contract. Subsequently, the attacker swapped a portion of the acquired $SHIDO tokens for $ETH and transferred 692.8 $ETH, equivalent to $2.4 million, to address 0x4621e0cd8c91ecf1b0efcbf07f0838a5ee25c5dd. The remaining $SHIDO tokens, valued at $1.6 million, are still retained in the attacker's address 0x1982358c84da9d0b4b96fc9e8564d132f7d0041f.Block Data ReferenceOwnership Transfer Transaction: https://etherscan.io/tx/0xaa76ea503fadddf775b1ef7f195676440fdc3ac46ab642798ab6fa7ae3aafcbeAttacker's ETH Address: 0x4621e0cd8c91ecf1b0efcbf07f0838a5ee25c5dd

Title: Seneca Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryExploitation of Seneca Protocol Leads to $6.5 Million Asset LossDetails of the ExploitOn February 28, 2024, Seneca Protocol experienced exploitation on both the Ethereum Mainnet and Arbitrum Chain due to a smart contract vulnerability. The vulnerability, rooted in an arbitrary external call vulnerability within the protocol's contracts, enabled attackers to drain assets. Specifically, the vulnerable contracts contained a _call function that lacked sufficient restrictions on the types of calls allowed and failed to adequately validate callee addresses. Exploiting this, attackers manipulated the performOperations function to craft calldata triggering arbitrary calls, facilitating unauthorized token transfers to their addresses.Block Data ReferenceExploiter Addresses:0x98c6ced9b18d57ee58820e61aa126c0fec30435d0xfeb5BCbB85E77F42b9B89d8772d4f6C7C5183Aa4Exploit tx:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x0eb8f8d148508e752d9643ccf49ac4cb0c21cbad346b5bbcf2d06974d31bd5c4https://etherscan.io/tx/0x9f3712672be7a120757d42fbe15ceefe9578914946bacbd0f3531e7fb7305576Malicious contract: https://etherscan.io/address/0x8d4de2bc1a566b266bd4b387f62c21e15474d12a#code

Title: BitForex Exit Scam
Description: Quick SummaryBitForex exchange exit scammed with suspicious outflows of approximately 56,500,000 USD across multiple blockchains.Details of the ExploitBitForex, a cryptocurrency exchange, shut down access to its platform after a suspicious outflow of approximately 56,500,000 USD across several blockchains. Users attempting to log in are blocked by CloudFlare's DDoS protection service. The exchange stopped processing withdrawals and has not been responding to customer support inquiries. The outflows appear to be an exit scam rather than an external attack. The funds were received from multiple addresses in BitForex's hot wallets, most of the funds were on the Ethereum chain, in the TRB tokens, and remain in wallets as of Feb 29,2024.Block Data ReferenceFunds Holder as of Feb 29, 2024:- Ethereum: https://etherscan.io/address/0xdCaCd7EB6692b816b6957f8898c1C4B63D1fC01F- Bitcoin: https://blockstream.info/address/3DbbF7yxCR7ni94ANrRkfV12rJoxrmo1o2- TRON: https://tronscan.org/#/address/TQcnqaU4NDTR86eA4FZneeKfJMiQi7i76oMalicious Transactions: Ethereum: https://etherscan.io/tx/0x1c81e61dcf61d63a28ca0a2591f89de6aa6a66ca477d00c3553d9f1f23c08a99https://etherscan.io/tx/0xb1ef6176112c8b019192b5e627732afee8930810801961ded081720e74544753 Bitcoin: https://blockstream.info/tx/47fcf20f582d6d8529be7e781940ecb8faf6357a897c4ec0b770cfa5df77d100 TRON: https://tronscan.org/#/transaction/5544ba78bf21106b0e740dadb4fa0269aa56d80668124513decef26d28280930

Title: ORE Token Rugpull
Description: Quick SummaryORE token rugpulled by deployer, removing liquidity worth 243,489 USD and creating potential rugpull token CHAT.Details of the ExploitORE is an ERC20 token trading on UniSwap. On Feb 26, 2024, the deployer removed 80.03 WETH worth approximately 243,489 USD from the liquidity pool. Stolen funds were distributed between multiple addresses using Disperse.app. A smaller portion of the stolen funds was transferred to another scammer's address, which created a new token named CHAT and deposited it into the liquidity pool, it appears potentially preparing for another rugpull.Block Data ReferenceDeployer Address:https://etherscan.io/address/0xAD13D88da898Bb8f53A5038fd2537598FaC25b5CScammer's Address:https://etherscan.io/address/0x3c714dcc89641Bd18A07Ec7F8824eFc2ca575c56Liquidity Removal Transaction:https://etherscan.io/tx/0xb8f05ade5a50a7e9d37cbb8409279c2f5c0560b94768fb894e15179815b184ecDisperse.app Distribute Transaction:https://etherscan.io/tx/0xdc860e7e917764a504ff7bc885870ad041c756521a59973fc6e259eb4517e6c2CHAT Token Address:https://etherscan.io/token/0x068e8C05edCD392Ac997A15B9135EEd8a6eA0c46

Title: RiskOnBlast Exit Scam
Description: Quick SummaryRiskOnBlast rugpulled 1,259,575 USD (420.50 ETH) from over 750 users, transferring funds to multiple exchanges and services.Details of the ExploitRiskOnBlast, a gambling and trading platform on the Blast layer-2 ecosystem, performed a rugpull, misappropriating 420.50 ETH worth approximately 1,259,575 USD from more than 750 users. The exploiter withdrew all funds held in the ROB contract, swapping them to DAI. The scammer transferred stolen funds through Change Now, MEXC, ByBit Exchange and others. The project's social media profiles have been deleted.Block Data ReferenceScammer Address:https://etherscan.io/address/0x1EeB963133f657Ed3228d04b8CD9a13280EFC558Malicious Contract Address:https://etherscan.io/address/0x25f8C342E430C85829Ef5021C0720f0c60969840Liquidity Removal Transaction:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x68e96762a8a62ff54fb8107b107cd7fc26e6defc921cefed6e69a5dab136a36bBybit Deposit Transaction:https://etherscan.io/tx/0xd912de8351d03f1be42dd2151a28b4c82d28517483fa0078be78a66ed98609a4ChangeNow Deposit Transaction:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x8ecb4f7666b8c85e7b8be2eb6c885dd89fc76f163a7a666ee600e2920554848bMEXC Deposit Transaction:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x9ddd6a35470fa765f514c4edddabac9b25b73a9e44eedd7f5df4e6e57ea92e3c

Title: User lost 17 ETH via Phishing Attack
Description: Quick SummaryUser falls victim to phishing scam, mistakenly sending 17 ETH (approx. 48,030 USD) to attacker's address.Details of the ExploitOn February 15, 2024, a user fell victim to a phishing scam. The attacker made two transactions that appeared identical to the victim's last transaction at the time. The victim mistakenly sent 17 ETH to the scammer's address. The attacker address's first five and last five characters are the same as an address that previously sent 15.09 ETH to the victim's address. The stolen funds were then distributed among multiple addresses.Block Data ReferenceAttacker Address:https://etherscan.io/address/0xC6e563F6eF051C002aa89363cd35f7b29E599d77Malicious Transaction:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x71fba2a15cbb503a9f8d093877e5be045d6c86c1470a9ec30a321e5cd178ffc9Funds Holder as of Feb 24, 2024:https://etherscan.io/address/0xC6e563F6eF051C002aa89363cd35f7b29E599d77Attackers Imitated Transactions:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x0aa57d6961b19cec26d85e52159b3ec0a284e8fb88ba9fb4654b3e1c9501bdc4https://etherscan.io/tx/0x0b1981513ecee0541b5e11a295dd2fbea609b37b2898d879b5a9e9cb34ab2c4e

Title: DualPools Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryDualPools DeFi project was exploited via a smart contract vulnerability, resulting in a loss of 41,286 $USD.Details of the ExploitDualPools, a DeFi project offering Swap, Lend, and Borrow services, was exploited on February 15, 2024. The attacker manipulated the price of dLINK by exploiting insufficient liquidity in a new DualPools pool and depleted targeted assets (WBNB, BTC, ETH, ADA, BUSD) from other pools through the borrow function. Additionally, the attacker exploited a precision truncation issue in the smart contract division, reclaiming all previously invested LINK. The stolen funds were swapped to BNB, transferred to another EOA, and then after a week deposited into the TornadoCash .Block Data ReferenceAttacker Address:https://bscscan.com/address/0x4645863205b47a0A3344684489e8c446a437D66CAdditional Attacker's Address:https://bscscan.com/address/0x7F27C9ed8CEb95Ae69E8361221fe17100f826616Malicious Transaction:https://bscscan.com/tx/0x90f374ca33fbd5aaa0d01f5fcf5dee4c7af49a98dc56b47459d8b7ad52ef1e93Malicious Contract Address:https://bscscan.com/address/0x38721b0d67DFdba1411BB277d95AF3D53FA7200ETornadoCash Deposit Transactions:https://bscscan.com/tx/0xcedff18c5478037f057072a9dc2eb808398c47e8c2023f4848430a73e5b741c2https://bscscan.com/tx/0x7de2a931257c5a2aef16a410402729fb238e7c35f6f40e6304d62c95a2aa24ec

Title: Particle Trade's Contract Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryParticle trade, a decentralized leverage trading protocol, was exploited, resulting in the loss of 141,684 USD worth 50.12 WETH.Details of the ExploitParticle trade is a permissionless decentralized leverage trading protocol for any digital asset. On February 15, 2024, the project was exploited due to a contract vulnerability in its previously deprecated NFT contract. The contract does not check the user input data for onERC721Received() function which make the order 'legit' and manipulated the accountBalance. The current protocol of Particle trade was not impacted by this security incident, confirmed by @wukong_particle in a post on the X. The attacker deposited the stolen funds into TornadoCash.Block Data ReferenceAttacker Address:https://etherscan.io/address/0x2c903F97Ea69B393Ea03E7FAb8D64D722b3f5559Malicious Transaction:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x2cc3c3cfbdf04441f3349e49768c909ac252ace6f78b24a25d4700a47883514aMalicious Contract Address:https://etherscan.io/address/0xE55607B2967DDbE5FA9A6A921991545b8277Ef8FTornadoCash Deposit Transactions:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x4bb78bbf3305ab38464fd6a210e64cb3d5f6b672eeb10ed5953ec07db447bcc4https://etherscan.io/tx/0x32fe57bd3bf9554d1e4d93c09207027c84886179884c6668b05883c0f5220894

Title: DeezNutz Exploited
Description: Quick SummaryDeez Nutz Protocol exploited via flash loan attack, resulting in a loss of $174,086 USD worth 58.65 WETH.Details of the ExploitOn February 21, 2024, Deez Nutz, a protocol focused on NFTs, Tokenization, and DeFi, experienced an exploit due to a contract vulnerability and a flash loan attack. The attacker, identified as bigbrainchad.eth, targeted the erc404 series of tokens from DeezNutz_404 on Ethereum, causing an estimated total loss of around $170,000. The exploit involved a bug in the code that allowed the attacker to mint infinite tokens and steal approximately 58.65 ETH. The root cause was an incorrect calculation when transferring tokens to self, which enabled the attacker to mint infinite tokens and sell them.The stolen funds still remaining attacker's address as of Feb 24,2024.Block Data ReferenceAttacker address:https://etherscan.io/address/0xd215FFaf0F85fB6f93F11E49Bd6175ad58af0DfdFunds Holder as of Feb 24, 2024:https://etherscan.io/address/0xed65b99E31628B2Ea26D2129647508a8f1164c9AMalicious transaction:https://etherscan.io/tx/0xbeefd8faba2aa82704afe821fd41b670319203dd9090f7af8affdf6bcfec2d61Malicious contract:https://etherscan.io/address/0xd129D8C12f0e7aA51157D9e6cc3F7Ece2dc84ecD

Title: Jeffrey Zirlin's wallets compromise
Description: Quick SummaryJeffrey Zirlin "Jihoz", Axie Infinity co-founder, experienced a private key compromise, resulting in a loss of approximately 9,700,000 USD.Details of the ExploitOn February 23, 2024, Jihoz_Axie tweeted on his  X (formerly twitter) about compromise of his two personal wallet addresses,. The attacker stole assets from these wallets, swapped them to Ronin WETH, and bridged them to the Ethereum mainnet using Axie Infinity:Ronin Bridge. The stolen funds were then transferred to other EOA addresses and eventually deposited into TornadoCash through several addresses.Block Data ReferenceAttacker Address:https://ronin.bloks.io/address/0x39f817976c51a91b60145febad81067e69713105Additional Attacker's Addresses:https://etherscan.io/address/0xA4017DE6460bD63a77404dd2C2344D6135eD13b2https://etherscan.io/address/0x73f428e1037a310d472A24100dA37fB1d8dEC8B8Malicious Transactions:https://ronin.bloks.io/transaction/0xe5fcb3ea3993811a23eb919a2c78806a9af7ea907f0c5abf4d85394aba937003https://ronin.bloks.io/transaction/0x002e0c2213ea72c5ea749f6fa00f74c7bfab792189255fe9046c3aa865a68d1fhttps://ronin.bloks.io/transaction/0x87841c81acde4828c10e7ce51f033c1bca613a0eaee2000a1ee6df3c3827830eTornadoCash Deposit Transactions:https://etherscan.io/tx/0xeb112a223824994c1990067a9f2ba078edee8854ecc862e6c3f996faed669ab9https://etherscan.io/tx/0x24055d9abad17c1ee2c374171291faaaa3fceec5ffb8ebed32a709f1f3a1a5c7

Title: Blueberry's Protocol Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryBlueberry DeFi leverage project exploited due to a contract vulnerability, resulting in the loss of 91 $ETH or approximately 266,023 $USD.Details of the ExploitBlueberry, a decentralized financial lending and leverage protocol, suffered an exploit on February 23, 2024.An attacker attempted to exploit the vulnerability, but was overtaken by c0ffeebabe.eth, a well-known MEV bot and whitehat operator that had previously beaten other exploits and returned funds to projects. Initially 457.7 ETH was withdrawn from the project, but 366.6 ETH was of that was able to be returned.The remaining 91 ETH, worth about $1,350,000, was lost due to validator payments.Block Data ReferenceValidator Payment Transaction:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x6b6231c19ffde66d5a8810f06a61ce79d201c039a8460dba1b802fd76b3d3853Funds Return Transaction:https://etherscan.io/tx/0xc4d45a5143d04d98f11c56f0944ad60426bfbe70b25b5b43a95f0e61a9386a52c0feebabe.eth's Contract Address:https://etherscan.io/address/0x3AA228a80F50763045BDfc45012dA124Bd0a6809

Title: MangoFarmSOL Exitscam
Description: Quick SummaryMangoFarmSOL exit scammed, stealing 1,297,344 USD worth of SOL (13,514 tokens) from users and deleting their website and Twitter account.Details of the ExploitMangoFarmSOL, a yield farming protocol on the Solana blockchain, encouraged users to deposit Solana tokens into the protocol to earn airdrops. On January 6, 2024, the project conducted an exit scam, withdrawing a total of 13,514 SOL tokens (worth around 1.29 million USD) deposited by users. The stolen funds primarily consisted of SOL tokens, which were then laundered through various channels, first bridging to the Ethereum network via wormhole and allbridge and then deposited into platforms such as Railgun and eXch. The acquired USDC was bridged from the Solana network to Ethereum via the wormhole bridge. The project subsequently deleted their website and Twitter account.Block Data ReferenceScammer Address:https://explorer.solana.com/address/FLq2GE2x4kv5UbK6Qw2h9FtBPcLeZnNhwSeGvDDokYbHAdditional Scammer Addresses:https://explorer.solana.com/address/8ggviFegLUzsddm9ShyMy42TiDYyH9yDDS3gSGdejND7https://explorer.solana.com/address/8FNFfU47C2W4kEZv3kJ7r4S4LrUNoB5tJ4NGm2TwdGW6Funds Withdraw Transaction:https://explorer.solana.com/tx/2HFZyg21afEgKy9NgM7p4TQFzA33ppNWwsSoLyh61wxRFB2ELkpsKPECwu4PrUtRNF3TvmJZbXmQ4thjw3gFcLK9https://explorer.solana.com/tx/nod1VcqpUm9K5sexbJFyZSfQZpY9qJwgyQGRdtqHMEmjQ1RExtqcdsdqQBQeQ3YKqFbd9Z3YUzJ6s9t3FCFoLJKeXch, Railgun Deposit Transaction:https://etherscan.io/tx/0xe2903d42940795051a2f2ea088a9193742692f95269dbc30d026a688f18f3d17https://etherscan.io/tx/0xe21d849682fbed06a906dc4dee18ae9fd8386fbc59c76ce65bad9661518ac5dd

Title: BEAM Token Phishing
Description: Quick SummaryPhishing Scam Results in $5.17 Million Loss of BEAM TokensDetails of the ExploitA victim, identified by the address 0x83664b8a83b9845ac7b177df86d0f5bf3b7739ad, fell prey to a phishing scam resulting in the loss of $5.17 million worth of BEAM tokens. The scam involved the victim signing an 'increaseAllowance' transaction, with the token spender being a GnosisSafe wallet address 0xbaEE148DF4bf81aBf9854c9087F0D3a0fFd93DBB.Block Data ReferenceBEAM Token transferring: https://etherscan.io/tx/0x4f77f93bcee2ee8f85e128e51cf303c01393c243e2227f000fadeb9cef8e29b1Scammers' Addresses:0x98c6ced9b18d57ee58820e61aa126c0fec30435d0xfeb5BCbB85E77F42b9B89d8772d4f6C7C5183Aa40x09e0cA7E92E2B893f07cdAE75C011C3606ecD61a

Title: AAX
Description: Quick SummaryAlleged May Laundering Involving 24,000 ETH Linked To AAH Exchange Amid Operational SuspensionDetails of the ExploitThe ongoing investigation into the AAX Exchange unveils potential money laundering activities involving over 24,000 Ethereum (ETH) amidst the exchange's suspension of operations. Blockchain analysts at Cyvers Alerts reported anomalous transactions originating from wallets allegedly associated with AAX, a crypto exchange under scrutiny following FTX's bankruptcy. The transactions, totaling over $55.5 million worth of ETH, purportedly aimed at laundering funds through decentralized exchange (DEX) platforms like UmbraCash and 1inch, with some funds being routed to the TRON blockchain via SwftCoin. Analysts noted patterns indicative of attempts to circumvent anti-money laundering measures, including blacklisting by Tether Inc. Meanwhile, AAX's operational suspension, announced on November 14, 2022, for data proofreading and restoration, underscores the exchange's challenges. As investigations continue, the focus remains on factual analysis, highlighting key developments without emotional bias. Stay updated for further insights as the investigation unfolds.

Title: Fixed Float Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryFixedFloat cryptocurrency exchange was exploited, resulting in the loss of 409.304 BTC and 1,728.48 ETH worth approximately $26,130,157 USD.Details of the ExploitFixedFloat, a cryptocurrency exchange platform, was exploited on February 16, 2024. The attacker stole approximately $26.1 million worth of Bitcoin and Ethereum. Most of the money stolen was on the Bitcoin chain, funds were distributed between multiple addresses. The stolen funds on the Ethereum Mainnet were transferred to the eXch exchange through multiple addresses, with a small portion deposited into HitBTC. Additional clarifications regarding the incident were not disclosed by FixedFloat.Block Data ReferenceAttacker Addresses:https://www.blockchain.com/btc/address/bc1q2skp47p9f5mr4n4m27k66v0l68gh3xdd7ad4e5https://etherscan.io/address/0x85c4fF99bF0eCb24e02921b0D4b5d336523Fa085Funds Holder as of Feb 19, 2024:https://etherscan.io/address/0x2c01cAB6ebf147e4d5d4db01582f16EBcfF22d8FMalicious Transactions:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x1faa4861a2c32ceaa7c483e8dc91c18e3a9247bac7f2588903691a7a1db4ece8 https://etherscan.io/tx/0x8f0bd0a0b25788a59d979a58ce4edfba8956679d7a10e1e6ce12ce945e6ce740 https://etherscan.io/tx/0x9822616097948dab2048395c4d887dbb1f99273e5cc40de2d86639013588df41 https://etherscan.io/tx/0x15f7ac31837c8dba597f46359857205df1c41573c4bb489b5a81fd058be5da6dhttps://blockstream.info/tx/9822616097948dab2048395c4d887dbb1f99273e5cc40de2d86639013588df41https://blockstream.info/tx/15f7ac31837c8dba597f46359857205df1c41573c4bb489b5a81fd058be5da6dHitBTC Deposit Transaction:https://etherscan.io/tx/0xe717258efc288dd7f805163da048c361c6c3377d6f38c184bbf48e0f1e889e69

Title: xPet Smart Contract Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryxPET, a Social Fi and Game Fi platform on Arbitrum, was exploited due to a smart contract vulnerability, resulting in a loss of 91.5 ETH worth 256,570 USD.Details of the ExploitOn February 16, 2024, xPET's on-chain PvP contract was exploited, allowing the attacker to withdraw a large amount of $BPET tokens. The vulnerability was related to the newly launched PvP feature. The attacker dumped over 1 million BPET tokens to obtain 91.5 ETH, which was then transferred to another EOAs and bridged to the Ethereum chain via Across Protocol. The CEO of xPET, @Michaeltalkhere posted on X account that how they got the money back.The attacker returned all part of the stolen funds in two transactions on Feb 17,2024.Block Data ReferenceAttacker Address:https://arbiscan.io/address/0x22518a5c1f3e29b01d8b04145953ce20d3c99f31Funds Holder as of Feb 17, 2024:https://arbiscan.io/address/0x0671E3357655AaCe65fCBe323293A6760579B6e1Malicious Transactions:https://arbiscan.io/tx/0x058b8808e721f68c01c62ad70687f38f39d749bfc9d0e8f6be839c3af603dec6https://arbiscan.io/tx/0x1ad1f7536e2d91cc5aeef6e29f948ee73fa760a482b0455ca78adade83c4ef53Funds Returned Transactions:https://arbiscan.io/tx/0x825e63fdf68c773f7a9b3a440b1bdce4640e4530af6fc2653982ed29bed541eehttps://arbiscan.io/tx/0xaeb79241df56b3d1af84815c64ceb145a652e97eb101b572232fb4ca039c2573Bridged Transaction via Across Protocol:https://arbiscan.io/tx/0x43230132c5e285a084b7ab9454682828fbba9b6c34f3f4c60367a166b09276bfCEO's post on X about stolen funds reward:https://twitter.com/Michaeltalkhere/status/1758558740461306362

Title: MINER Smart Contract Vulnerability
Description: Quick SummaryThe MINER's smart contract was exploited, resulting in a loss of 466,624 USD worth 168.6 WETH.Details of the ExploitMINER is a collection of 100,000 avatars tied to the first tokens built on ERC-X, a fully optimized, experimental standard that enables the use of multiple token standards. On Feb 14, 2024, the project was exploited due to a double-transfer vulnerability caused by a lack of input validation in the update function. The attacker performed several malicious transactions, exploiting the vulnerability to get free tokens by sending tokens to themselves. The stolen funds were transferred to another EOA and still remain in this address as of Feb 17, 2024. The MINER team posted on their platform that they have sent an on-chain message to the hacker, offering a bounty of 120,000 USD, approximately equivalent to 25% of the exploited funds.Block Data ReferenceAttacker Address:https://etherscan.io/address/0xea75AeC151f968b8De3789CA201a2a3a7FaeEFbAFunds Holder as of Feb 17, 2024:https://etherscan.io/address/0xC181dE2f3B0976C266fD5d5d58e101e365f34a70Malicious Transactions:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x5cc93e9d5adec2b432ddf8052ed77a052e07671db36954675d6f55df28bdb8c0https://etherscan.io/tx/0xddacdc06b84e572754011faa35add7445cd0f547d351aeee36556df89d53e8dbhttps://etherscan.io/tx/0xd22b05fffe2fc29fa7e0c9d7d9d4151ed9cde9361bb4f7127d56abd7c8cde1b2Malicious Contract Address:https://etherscan.io/address/0xBfF51C9C3D50d6168DFEF72133F5DBda453EbF29On-chain message offering a bounty to the attacker:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x27a01149b321eaab0b16d488aefaffa04517a5cf73397b1bbcb8192a4db692ae

Title: GAME Reentrancy Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryGAME experienced a reentrancy attack resulting in a loss of 49,596 USD.Details of the ExploitOn February 12, 2024, an attacker exploited a reentrancy vulnerability in a GAME's smart contract by repeatedly calling the makeBid() function. The stolen funds were transferred to another EOAs and then the part was deposited into FixedFloat, while the remainder was sent to an unknown address with over 2 million transactions. The attacker obtained 1.1 ETH from an address to which sent some of the stolen funds after the attack. The attack began approximately 7 hours after the exploited contract was created.Block Data ReferenceAttacker Address:https://etherscan.io/address/0x145766A51ae96E69810fE76f6f68Fd0e95675A0BAddress which funded the attacker:https://etherscan.io/address/0x077D360f11D220E4d5D831430c81C26c9be7C4A4Malicious Transactions:https://etherscan.io/tx/0xe07fa7cf5f590ea82cf195923549722f924857537111aeb3824359d3e1c2e32fhttps://etherscan.io/tx/0x1624cd342758019872713c31965f983a9154cc22c04430164be506bc1a68f6c7https://etherscan.io/tx/0x0eb8f8d148508e752d9643ccf49ac4cb0c21cbad346b5bbcf2d06974d31bd5c4Malicious Contracts:https://etherscan.io/address/0x8d4dE2Bc1a566b266bD4B387f62C21e15474D12ahttps://etherscan.io/address/0x327aa670AABeAaC9B8F099E4827e04e957B66dCdFixedFloat Deposit Transaction:https://etherscan.io/tx/0xf19de65bca3fcdd709713529e4728d50de57b03df9cf6d5a3de6a6fcf057464b

Title: Duelbits Access Control
Description: Quick SummaryDuelbits crypto casino was exploited through access control breach, resulting in a loss of 4,643,315 USD.Details of the ExploitDuelbits, a crypto casino and sports betting platform, experienced an exploit on February 13, 2024. The attacker gained access to a Duelbits wallet. The root cause of this exploit appears to be a loss of wallet access control. The attacker stole various assets, including ETH, BNB, BUSD, USDT, SHIBA INU, and ApeCoin, totaling a loss of 4,643,315 USD. The stolen funds were bridged, exchanged to ETH, and transferred to another EOA address.Block Data ReferenceAttacker Address:https://bscscan.com/address/0x3933924FAf011aE8d24e44beE450b3d78E46a666Funds Holder Address as of Feb 15, 2024:https://bscscan.com/address/0x0428eEfB47fB6ffb870C6b9608dA4C72bC7645f5Malicious Transactions: https://bscscan.com/tx/0x3bf414c5a62704cc917242336394eeeed15a7e1a50e857c15e611dab92999aa4 https://bscscan.com/tx/0x554d974b9ec9c9181a5055c1a10ea3fac33ce3d149964ded6ee679493255c580 https://bscscan.com/tx/0xe22ab335dbad59de1e5fe291b1d472d4efac34568870f570ea3f5458cbf3be7e

Title: Not Found Token Rugpull
Description: Quick SummaryNot Found (404) token rugpull by deployer, liquidity removed from UniSwap pool, resulting in a loss of 199,927 USD.Details of the ExploitNot Found, an ERC-20 token trading on UniSwap, experienced an exit scam when its deployer swapped a significantly larger number of tokens, depleting the liquidity. The deployer then called "TokenURI" and inflated the amount of 404 tokens. A portion of the stolen funds was transferred to other EOAs and deposited into FixedFloat, while the majority was bridged to the Arbitrum chain through Orbiter Finance. The scammer received funding from OKX. The total loss amounts to 199,927 USD, equivalent to 82.38 WETH.Block Data ReferenceScammer Address:https://etherscan.io/address/0x3a6d1143536751965534d8D5beB6D4299330C921Malicious Transactions:https://etherscan.io/tx/0xe6c3bfdd29713237b6cbc18f2afd859e94cf962aafe63561e62091f3edd3f0cdhttps://etherscan.io/tx/0x99cda6c9a2cb3d73d7d5fa25d4d74a9ed8e45477086ef4b54662103cfa15e127FixedFloat Deposit Transactions:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x84dad5f810b427dd9a3191dc28a2ebc0f026598ec1cf3c0d39012a9f8ff59dbchttps://etherscan.io/tx/0xcf7a2853d8a29a0406fe75d103d19c7c6bdb16db19d0e5a17243d388d1db85caOrbiter Finance Bridge Transactions:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x3e20376f6ee4d164604e99c63c8442f7af28e5e0df2f88309c5e6bfc51e2a171https://etherscan.io/tx/0x679a4b006cb166a7a60d1e35f1024b25e6530a2135212447ef131aed916a397f

Title: PlayDapp Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryPlayDapp, an Ethereum-based P2E game, was exploited due to compromised private keys, resulting in a loss of 1.79 billion PLA tokens worth around 32,350,000 USD.Details of the ExploitPlayDapp, a P2E game running on the Ethereum chain, was exploited two times,between Feb 9-12, 2024. The root cause of the exploit was reportedly due to the compromise of private keys. Before the first exploit transactions, a new minter was added to the PlayDapp: PLA Token. The attacker minted a total of 1.79 billion PLA tokens in two separate incidents, worth around 287,775,772 USD at the time. However, the attacker was able to convert only 32 million USD. The stolen funds were transferred to various addresses, with some being deposited on the Polygon chain, Binance exchange, and a significant portion remaining in the scammer's address as of Feb 13, 2024. The attacker was funded by FixedFloat. A reward of 1 million USD was offered to the hacker for the immediate return of all stolen contracts and assets.Block Data ReferenceAttacker's Initial Address:https://etherscan.io/address/0xD151050d43c28690766f50Ce9ea8686c5D243a40Attacker's Additional Addresses:https://etherscan.io/address/0x1cae9eAa76E880fe47A26dd838E5Ec056C289155https://etherscan.io/address/0xe84d086f2c402d297d05b1bccc06d0e0942ec03chttps://etherscan.io/address/0x23cAeE3666b553445e430D1635AD64fBF388B07dFunds Holders as of Feb 13, 2024:https://etherscan.io/address/0xa03400E098F4421b34a3a44A1B4e571419517687https://etherscan.io/address/0xA8eF5e00525592d625B8d0AfC007Aa826a06C738Malicious Transactions:https://etherscan.io/tx/0xe8be05f6a3360f63b9e78a30b4ba16ea4c7d0b530a8abf99390f1c831851fb7ehttps://etherscan.io/tx/0xc41687511e31f5612b73647c4b39e500e45dbfb2ae66789b7b8705d2336002f8https://etherscan.io/tx/0x5f73c86a516616e25b3d13188f3289472d22a06cb1029ff174e00596a97e13b9Binance Deposit Transaction:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x964837f1cffd9d54aae2d8a2083a8927219095ff7857194865b65b1d32669414Gate.io Deposit Transaction:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x1cb750dfcd6a425eac3013a4b0994eaa719d5e6824196fe3c06dafe4b6fa55a2"Add Minter" Transaction:https://etherscan.io/tx/0xe834f28377b79759ac5495a91975a01e0876af9aae312228c1ac525846406170Polygon Chain Bridge Transaction:https://etherscan.io/tx/0xfae62c49a680b22bc4f591cff9af57e86d5219f667307e3a06b96c77b417eba4On-chain message to the hacker:https://etherscan.io/tx/0xb8c379f3ae8ea3ba48cdb7dac79c9b995f0e7a372a8bf9d620a6bfc875a31628

Title: Phishing Victim
Description: Quick SummaryUser on Binance Smart Chain fell victim to a phishing scam, resulting in the loss of 85,467 $USD worth 2.009 $BTCB.Details of the ExploitOn February 5, 2024, a user on the Binance Smart Chain was tricked into signing an IncreaseAllowance scam transaction to a phishing address. The stolen funds were transferred to multiple EOAs and then bridged to the ETH mainnet through LI.FI, Celer Network, and a portion was deposited into Binance. Some of the funds still remain in the scammer's address. The total loss is approximately 85,467 USD worth 2.009 BTCB.Block Data ReferenceAttacker Addresses:https://bscscan.com/address/0xACE6667b540ccd011377670571853461c83bb35Chttps://bscscan.com/address/0x994794Af23013F5CA7D56397aeEa80d882f34B96Funds Holder as of Feb 06, 2024:https://bscscan.com/address/0xf7f7525365CF18Fc3663084a64c5495d32C40C39https://bscscan.com/address/0x15eBbBCd16f4B4376F44613C109DF2c06C36c2eEhttps://bscscan.com/address/0x75568Cb0A73b489E7C1808a62836A127E210cF23Malicious Transaction:https://bscscan.com/tx/0xbf8591a8c0ad9d1faeaa39790a916baf1d267a7a17c2f49ab1a10f6884681decMalicious Contract:https://bscscan.com/address/0x000b2191F8461a2D1f33B30a16f37Cd30cF60000LI.FI Diamond Deposit Transaction:https://bscscan.com/tx/0x09dd0f1db6df5933371f47928528226aedd2dd165e424737b05acc0bf946fc38Binance Deposit Transactions:https://bscscan.com/tx/0x490fc8ad9ed5a66e35b12f64da353e0bf190cd936aee711f35aaac657b76c5e1https://bscscan.com/tx/0x9b04e482250200f3de18ef82912787d422477bca1f34b23037287a5b18cc16bf

Title: A victim of PinkDrainer
Description: Quick SummaryThe user on Ethereum chain suffered a phishing scam, losing 73.85 wstETH worth approximately $195,887 USD.Details of the ExploitOn February 4, 2024, a user fell victim to a phishing scam. The victim signed an "Increase Allowance" transaction, which allowed the attacker to steal 73.85 wstETH (worth around $195,887 USD) from the wallet. The attacker first stole 18.46 wstETH and then, almost immediately, another 55.39 wstETH. Most of the stolen funds were exchanged for ETH and still remain in one of the attacker's addresses as of February 7, 2024.Block Data ReferenceAttacker's Addresses:https://etherscan.io/address/0x63605E53D422C4F1ac0e01390AC59aAf84C44A51https://etherscan.io/address/0x9fA7bB759641FCd37fe4aE41f725e0f653f2C726Increase Allowance Transactionhttps://etherscan.io/tx/0x31c686527636368c7a6915289298a06d117e3959cd4b5703fbb1f060a270b4ffMalicious Transactions:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x58793d067e575c1db6ef96846ab768f48e657f5d9820563f5361db94a84c95dahttps://etherscan.io/tx/0x254cfade1981fecb3dbfc18b9f665d38a9f848a9b01f9b19d54bc52db3bf279cFunds Holder as of Feb 7, 2024:https://etherscan.io/address/0x888A44b12EAe8D9078789eE960f0ce404D3EBa20

Title: Saga DAO Exploit
Description: Quick SummarySaga DAO's founder's wallet was exploited, resulting in 60,000 USD worth of SOL drained from the MultiSig wallet.Details of the ExploitSaga DAO, a community-driven project, experienced an access control exploit on January 24, 2024. The attacker allegedly hacked the founder's wallet and drained funds from the MultiSig wallet. Rumors suggest that it might have been an insider attack, as the MultiSig required only one signer out of twelve confirmations. The founder admitted to several security failures, including not using a cold wallet, not checking the threshold of signatures, and not using auto-unlock on Phantom.

Title: Chris Larsen's wallet was hacked
Description: Quick SummaryRipple co-founder Chris Larsen's personal account on Ripple chain was hacked, resulting in a loss of 213 million XRP tokens worth approximately $112.5 million.Details of the ExploitOn January 30, 2024, Ripple co-founder and executive chairman Chris Larsen was the victim of a hack of his personal account. This led to the theft of 213 million XRP tokens, worth approximately $112.5 million. The stolen assets were laundered through Kraken, KuCoin, Gate, Binance, MEXC, FixedFloat, and Whitebit, Huobi, EXMO and others. Blockchain detective zachxbt noticed and posted about incident the strange movement of around 213 million XRP, the native token for the Ripple project.Ripple CEO Chris Larsen later went on X (formerly Twitter) to claim that the funds that were stolen had come from his personal wallets and not from wallets belonging to the Ripple project.Block Data ReferenceAttacker Address:https://xrpscan.com/account/rJNLz3A1qPKfWCtJLPhmMZAfBkutC2QojmFunded Addresses:https://xrpscan.com/account/rGhR13XyM43WdDaSMznHd5rZ4cJatybvEghttps://xrpscan.com/account/rHQVKntyfkDCPhEBL2ctryuEAkDZgckmmVhttps://xrpscan.com/account/rLsUemhuBZtF44rqqzneb2F9JgyrRYYd4thttps://xrpscan.com/account/rKPERax7t9iFvT3RHXn5nifyNpzp9a4hBahttps://xrpscan.com/account/rpjs4HLX1gJoEenH69PsQmXaXY22QhCYAThttps://xrpscan.com/account/rLRhugR4ysNa2xkt4E6fKN8krs9jatCp6whttps://xrpscan.com/account/rnCyeUNvfDbtTagGEPjBfTCBz6EqJjf2Ujhttps://xrpscan.com/account/rHVjfYzTaB8MzSoQGqpzH9barZr85QsZW7Funds Transfer Transactions:https://xrpscan.com/tx/7749F7605D8B9C10CEF8353CC3F976E3444A4B45CA8E03124C6CE4BE73814EC8https://xrpscan.com/tx/34322EB8769E9616DD7C0AA4C6FD0E255D1DD6A577C0C9754C343E63123F5B03https://xrpscan.com/tx/BB2A66793F3562B5949BB911F744B39A29B41D8D6B61B20AC3A99E672A4839B6Chris Larsen's post:https://twitter.com/chrislarsensf/status/1752742706462523882Zachxbt's post:https://twitter.com/zachxbt/status/1752694489905528943

Title: Citadel Finance Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryCitadel Finance suffers flash loan attack, losing about $97,000 USD worth of 43.34 ETH on Arbitrum chain.Details of the ExploitOn January 27th, 2024, Citadel Finance, a Treasury-Backed Protocol on the Arbitrum chain, was exploited through a flash loan attack. The attacker manipulated the price of underlying assets, specifically the WETH/USDC pair on the Camelot Router. By taking a flash loan of approximately 4500 WETH and depositing it with the Camelot LP, the attacker was able to manipulate the WETH/USDC.E pool pair. They then called the redeem function from the CITRedeem contract to get huge amounts of WETH from the treasury with a low amount of CIT. Approximately 30.95 CIT tokens were burned, and the attacker took away assets worth 21.326 WETH. The flash loan was repaid, and the attacker was able to retain the excess funds as profit. The attacker used this scheme a couple times. The stolen funds were transferred to another EOA and then deposited into Fixed Float, resulting in a total loss of $97,000 USD worth 43.34 ETH.Block Data ReferenceAttacker address:https://arbiscan.io/address/0xfCf88e5E1314cA3B6be7EEd851568834233F8b49Malicious transactions:https://arbiscan.io/tx/0xf52a681bc76df1e3a61d9266e3a66c7388ef579d62373feb4fd0991d36006855https://arbiscan.io/tx/0x89eafbcd3ce44285c00fae61dc4202dc2d63965ba20bce33ed92e417a23349a2Malicious contract:https://arbiscan.io/address/0xfCBf411237aC830DC892EdEC054f15ba7f9eA5A6Fixed Float Deposit transactions:https://arbiscan.io/tx/0x36bc4c82358269ff898208009997eb14bfc7af80f0b089c046f3d74bfb585725https://arbiscan.io/tx/0x62a0012a516de7d51eab74f15554f9c441fe7f304eab38ab86366b7c95bf1176https://arbiscan.io/tx/0xbc9811fb83ec046b39faadddf527bded8042878052760a153905468d42f3c145

Title: Abracadabra Money Exploit
Description: Quick SummaryAbracadabra Money lending platform exploited, resulting in a loss of 6,414,205 USD (2737.48 ETH).Details of the ExploitAbracadabra Money, a DeFi crypto lending platform, was exploited on January 30, 2024. The root cause of the exploit was a loss of precision during smart contract operations, specifically a rounding issue. Preliminary findings indicate that the attacker targeted specific Cauldrons V3 & V4, allowing unauthorized MIM borrowing.The attacker was funded by Tornado Cash The stolen funds were transferred to two other EOAs.Block Data ReferenceAttacker Address:https://etherscan.io/address/0x87F585809Ce79aE39A5fa0C7C96d0d159eb678C9Funds Holders as of Feb 01, 2024:https://etherscan.io/address/0xbD12D6054827ae3fc6D23B1aCf47736691b52Fd3https://etherscan.io/address/0x40d5FFA20fC0dF6bE4D9991938dAa54E6919c714Malicious Transactions:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x26a83db7e28838dd9fee6fb7314ae58dcc6aee9a20bf224c386ff5e80f7e4cf2https://etherscan.io/tx/0xdb4616b89ad82062787a4e924d520639791302476484b9a6eca5126f79b6d877Malicious Contracts:https://etherscan.io/address/0xc8a0324832362eEDdF8373A04DD7D8d382850CB1https://etherscan.io/address/0x193E045BeE45C7573Ff89b12601C745AF739CE67https://etherscan.io/address/0xE1091D17473b049CcCD65c54f71677Da85b77A45https://etherscan.io/address/0x13AF445F81B0DEcA5dCb2Be6A4C691F545c95912Funded by TornadoCash:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x63e64e7e6ea5c0acfe02f34b086a030af5efad18bf5e10f51b02c5fe8fdccf84
